We hope to see you there
name: Advanced WordPress Developer Dojo

desc: As a freelancer you can often find processes for developing a theme or setting up a development server. However, our community rarely discusses how a WordPress Consultant can identify those areas of our business that need process improvement. The month’s Deep Dive Discussion will be an interactive workshop that examines the key steps to identify workflow patterns and develop repeatable business processes. As a group, we will discuss how to identify and prioritize your WordPress Consulting business’ goals and objectives. We will look at how you document your current business processes, and how to identify  significant variations (process gaps)  in your workflow that may be affecting your productivity and profitability. Bring your specific  workflow issue and we will look at ways to develop a repeatable process that will align with the organization's goals and objectives.
name: How to Structure Processes for Your WordPress Business

desc: One of the biggest challenges for a WordPress beginner is getting traffic to their site  The goal of this month's WordPress Beginners Meetup is to give attendees some "Implement Tomorrow Morning", actionable strategies for attracting traffic to your site or blog.
name: Actionable Ideas for Driving Traffic to Your WordPress Site

desc:
Search Engine Optimization (SEO) can be perplexing for newcomers, but there are some basic pillars that remain consistent even as Google continually works to improve the way they find and rank content. This presentation will walk you through the three main pillars of SEO and provide tips for how to manage them for yourself. You’ll learn that SEO is really not that complicated if you focus on white hat / ethical techniques.

This month's WordPress Practitioner's meetup speaker,
Tommy Landry is an internet marketing consultant <" class="linkified">http://returnonnow.com/>;;;, certified master life coach <" class="linkified">http://tommylandry.com/>;;;, WordPress expert <" class="linkified">http://wordpressfreethemesclub.com/>;;;, ebook author <" class="linkified">http://50tipspublishing.com/>;;;, and entrepreneur <" class="linkified">http://howtogetbackyourex.net/>;;; with over 25 years of business and marketing experience, as well as a degree in and lifelong study of interpersonal communications and relationships. This is your chance to learn inbound marketing, and how to optimize your WordPress site from an industry expert.

Please share this great topic widely, & look forward to seeing you there!

P.S. Seating isn't the most comfortable at Build-A-Sign. If you have back issues, please consider bringing your own chair.
name: The 3 Pillars of SEO : basics you should know about Search Engine Optimization

desc:
If you have ever stared at a '$' or '#' prompt, or at a bunch of lines that contain only the character '~', and wondered what to do next... 

If you know of a "shell" as a molusk's exoskeleton... 

If the only thing you know about "vim" is how to spell it... 

...this meet-up is probably not for you. 

(You are still welcome, but we will likely move at a pace that's too fast for the information to be useful to you.) 

However: 

If you are familiar with the shell command line but want to learn tricks that give you the creds of a bespectacled bearded suspenders-wearing UNIX system administrator... 

If you use vim frequently enough (and who doesn't :) ) to get mildly frustrated by only knowing to use the cursor keys to navigate in a file... 

If you administer a variety of flavors of environments, and *NIX's are among them... 

If you have had exposure to, and needs to do, things on the UNIX shell command line and/or in the "vim" text editor on a *NIX or Windows system... 

...this meet-up is for you. 

Anna Nguyen will cover UNIX shell command lines tips and tricks, and basic commands for navigating and editing in "vim" as well as more advanced and more obscure (but useful) tips and tricks. 

I would like for this to be a "learn by doing" presentation, a "working session". Attendees should bring their laptop and follow along, trying the tips and tricks as they are being presented. I think the tips and tricks will "stick" better if you try them as you see them. However, if you don't feel like working too hard :) , I will have class notes available. 

If you bring a laptop, here are the prerequisites: 

1. Access to a *NIX shell command line: OS/X "Terminal", a "ssh" session into a remote *NIX server, or Cygwin "bash" on Windows. Install Cygwin (*NIX commands for Windows) from here: https://cygwin.com/install.html­ 

2. Access to vim or vim clone: vi/vim on *NIX, MacVIM on OS/X, gvim on Windows, etc. 

Anna's background: 

Anna Nguyen is a software engineer, and  has used various flavors of *NIX since the days of System III in the early 80s. She has used "vim" (and it precursor, "vi") since at least the mid-80s. As a result, she has an unreasonably large :) vocabulary of tips and tricks for using *NIX shell commands and vi/vim editor commands. (But also because of that, Ishe may be unaware of newer features of those, if there is indeed such a thing as "new features" for the UNIX shell command line and vi/vim!)
name: Bash shell command line tips & tricks, and vim tips & tricks

desc:
As we continue our Introverted Freelancer series, Sandi and Nick Batik will take a closer look at those tools in the WordPress ecosystem that help introverted freelancers Automate many of the marketing processes we need to expand our customer base.


In past meetups we have touched on this subject when discussing the basics of content marketing. This month we will examine the step-by-step process of the marketing funnel: Awareness, Interest, Decision, and Action. We will look at the tools you can use on your site to get the automation support a freelancer's needs. The class will conclude with a discussion how 'Permission Marketing (permission— engagement — call to action) can help you build your loyal tribe of followers, supporters and clients.  We look forward to seeing you there.
name: Expanding your Freelance Business with Automated Marketing Funnels

desc:
Thanks to our Sponsor, WP Engine, the organizers of the Austin WordPress Meetup are please to announce a Special Event, the WP Austin REST Day. The WPATX community of developers and practitioners are getting excited about all the new possibilities of the WordPress REST API. It has been a while since we have hosted a WPATX Dev Day, and we thought a day devoted to discussion about faster, easier WordPress development using the REST API would be appreciated. 


This event is designed for our WordPress Developer and Practitioner Community who want to learn how to use the WordPress REST API and explore some applications that are already using it.

WP Austin REST Day 
June 17, 2016 
9 am to 4 pm
WP Engine 10th Floor Classroom 

The WP Engine classroom will open at 8:30 am and our WP Engine sponsors will be providing Breakfast Tacos and Coffee to help fuel you through the morning sessions, and lunch to power you through an afternoon of learning and doing.

The full WP Austin REST Day schedule has not been finalized, but we have posted the highlights and what you can expect from the day.

The day will open with a series of presentations by experienced WordPress Developers, who will discuss how the WordPress REST API will give our design and development community more flexibility when building sites, plugins, and themes. Our presenters will address  new ways to interact with WordPress posts, users, comments, and taxonomies using the RESTful API standard, which will allow you to create, read, update, and delete the main WordPress objects and provides infrastructure for creating your own custom APIs. They will also discuss how the WordPress REST API can give us the opportunity to integrate with technologies currently outside the WordPress ecosystem.

As part of our WP Austin REST Day, we are putting together a WordPress REST API Resources Guide for our WPATX Developers and Practitioners. 

The morning session will open with several 20-minute presentations. 

Ryan Hoover will lead of the morning sessions off with:

Getting started with the REST API

• Get it installed on your site

• Access posts, comments, other information

• Incorporate it into your own site

Making your own REST API endpoint

• Give a walk through of the endpoint code structure

• Write an endpoint for getting a menu from the WP site

• Demonstration of a feature Ryan Hoover wrote for WP Engine to fetch menu items from a WordPress site

Non-JSON uses of the REST API

•  A demonstration of a REST API feature WP Engine uses to serve up post thumbnail images based on dynamic URLs

Ryan Oeltjenbruns will follow with:

 The traditional view of a web request (front end & back end)

• Quick understanding of the traditional web request workflow

• What does the back end do?

• What does the front end do?

The API approach

• Quick understanding of a more API focused web request workflow

• More generic html source + templates -- shifting some of the work to the front-end

• More Javascript heavy front ends that know how to interact with the API

How this shift directs the focus to the front end, and what this means for WordPress

• WordPress as a data store? An api? Huh?

• Themes -- what will happen to them? Will they go away? Not necessarily... but they CAN! How?

• Plugins -- where might these begin to focus and why. Focusing more on augmenting and correlating data than image sliders.

After the mid-morning break we will have a round-table discussion lead by the presenters to talk about the how the REST API will affect how we work and WordPress market place, with a follow-up Q&A.

The afternoon session of the WP Austin REST Day is where our members have the opportunity to exercise some of their new knowledge. We will break out into teams of 3-5 people to build their own desired tool using the REST API in some way.  Our WPATX team members will have the guidance of floater "REST API experts"  if they need them to help with implementation.

If a team chooses to start a project that will require more time to complete, we can have an async followup where teams can keep working together and share their results at the Advance WordPress Developer's Meetup in August.

Possible projects for the WPATX REST API Team build:

• REST API feed for wpaustin.com pulling updates into a widget that people can install on their own site

• Collaborative blogging platform where the WP Austin community can cross-blog each other easily. (If I have a blog and you have a blog, create an easy, automated means to share posts between our blogs)

• Feed of WordCamps and other conferences that members would be interested in (this may get more into RSS aggregation instead of the REST API?)

• OR any Mad Science REST API project you have been thinking about


WP Engine is contributing the full cost of the WP Austin REST Day as their way to helping the WPATX Community of Developers and Practitioners expand their knowledge base and skills. I know all our members join us in thanking WP Engine for 'Gifting' the WPATX Developer community with the opportunity to both learn about and be inspired by the upcoming challenges presented by the REST API. 

As a WPATX member, your investment is parking, a day away from your business, and spending time with your peers in a great environment to learn something new.  If you have not yet considered how the adoption of the REST API will effect your WordPress business, we encourage you to attend and learn from developers who are working with it everyday. 

If you have been using the WordPress REST API and would like to present or demo your WP REST API project, please contact Sandi Batik using Meetup messaging. 

One of the best comments I've read about the WordPress REST API is from a our good friend, Josh Pollack -

“Our community is hearing that the WP REST API is going to change WordPress and they haven’t seen that happen. I don’t see the WP REST API as changing WordPress. I see the WP REST API as a WordPress feature that makes it easier to interact with your site’s data.”


I hope we will see you at the 2016 WP Austin REST DAY!
name: Announcing the WP Austin REST Day!

desc:
Rich Plakas will lead this basic WP Security & Maintenance Presentation. 

Now that you have your site up and running it is time to address Site Security and Administration. As the popularity of WordPress has increased so has its attractiveness to hackers. 

Rich will review the basics of keeping your WordPress site secure and talk about some of current crop of WP security plugins and services available to keep your site and your online community safe.

He will also review how to keep your WordPress Core version and plugin version up to date.
name: Simple Ways to Secure and Maintain Your WordPress Website

desc:
User Experience & User Interface! We've heard a bit recently about the importance of user-centric design. Now let's hear from a pro about how we can improve our sites.

Lora Rowan hails from the City of Roses, but now calls Austin home. She has an interdisciplinary background with training in the visual arts, public health, and user experience design. She is enthusiastic about solving problems collaboratively and creatively, and loves to use great research to create even better designs.

Don't forget:
Seating isn't the most comfortable at this location, so you might want to bring your own portable lawn/lounge chair.
name: UX/UI - What You Need To Know

desc: eCommerce expert, Toyin Akinmusuru, will lead a discussion about recent updates and new features in WooCommerce that will affect both Developers and end users. The WooCommerce plugin is both incredibly versatile and amazingly robust. Toyin will address some of the challenges understanding understand and using WooCommerce features and its extensions effectively.  We look forward to seeing you there.
name: WooCommerce - Getting a Handle On What's New

desc: There are some amazing new tools that can help WordPress Freelancers use technology to help them manage their business from their website. At this month’s Deep Dive Nick Batik will discuss customer relationship management tools. CRMs can help you manage your customer information, increase sales and offer better service to your WordPress Clients. CRM tools helps you gather all your customer information in one location allow and provide valuable insights into your business’s history with that customer. We will look at some WordPress CRM plugins that offer you a better way to manage your freelancer business.
name: What WordPress Freelancers need to know about CRMs

desc:
Based on requests from our members, Nick and Sandi Batik will host an Open Q&A.  Bring your laptops and the questions you have been struggling with, or the site issues that have been keeping you up at night. 

This beginner’s session is designed for our dedicated WPATX DIY-ers who just need a little help figuring out the right plugin, the Best Practice, tip or trick to get your WordPress Site performing the way you intended.


We will also be asking our attendees what WordPress topics they would like the WPATX organizers to address in the balance of of our 2016 Beginner’s Meetup schedule.  We look forward to seeing you there — bring your questions and suggestions.
name: WPATX Beginner's Q&A Session

desc:
From freelancers to Agencies, if you can improve on your efficiency, you can increase your profitability. Doing so doesn’t have to be involve a huge investment or a thousand hours of time. We’ll look at some ways and tools you can use to make yourself more efficient.

—————

Pat Ramsey's bio:

Building relationships is key to any successful partnership, be it in business or life in general. At Crowd Favorite, Pat gets to do that every day as Director of Ongoing Client Support, where he leads a team providing development support, consultation, and strategy for enterprise clients. Pat has been a development director, an independent WordPress developer, a freelancer, and more.

When he's not building websites, Pat can be found organizing the Austin WordPress Meetup or helping with the tech networking community, Refresh Austin. He's been a trainer and advisor for Knowbility's Accessible Internet Rallies and AccessU, and a founder the WordPress conference “after-after” party, CigarCamp. Pat is a former Navy Reserve sailor, a native Texan, and enjoys cooking large quantities of crawfish.

—————

Don't forget: the seating at Build-a-Sign isn't the most comfortable, so if you have back issues you may want to bring your own chair.
name: Find your Efficiencies

desc:
Our Advanced Developer's meeting is back after participating in the WPATX Day of REST event, and taking the July 4th Holiday off.

Interested in hanging out with other WordPress Developers in a"hive mind" environment or sharing some cool new code? Then our August 2nd Developer's Coding Dojo is for you. 

There is no set topic or presenter — so bring your laptop, a coding project you have been putting off, and an appetite. Our great Sponsor, WP Engine, will host the meeting and will be providing Pizza and soft drinks to keep our WPATX Devs fueled through the Coding Dojo.


Come join us for some coding — this is a great opportunity to practice some WP code chops, and meet other Advanced WordPress Developers in our community. We hope to see you here. 


For those who want an after-meeting code chat, we will be adjourning downstairs to the 'A' bar. 


We hope to see you there
name: Advanced WordPress Developer Dojo

desc: This month's deep Dive Discussion will look at several strategies for implementing value-based pricing in your Freelance WordPress Business. Nick and Sandi Batik will review some industry standards for pricing your services and how experience, special knowledge, and skills affect the value you can offer your clients. Additionally, we will discuss how to qualify clients, so you are working with the kind of customers that appreciate how your special skill set and experience add value to their businesses.
name: The WordPress Freelancer and Value-Based Pricing

desc:
In this WordPress Beginners' session, Nick Batik will guide you through the wonderful world of WordPress Plugins. Even those new to WordPress will be familiar with the general concept of plugins. If you have been managing your WordPress site for a while you’ve probably chosen and installed a few plugins on your own.


We will discuss when using a plugin is a great idea, and when a plugin might be the wrong solution. Those new to WordPress need to know the disadvantages of using too many plugins, and what using the wrong plugin can do to your site’s performance.  

If you have ever wonderedwhich of the thousands of Plugins in the WordPress Repository Developers consider 'Must-Haves' in their professional toolkit, Nick will share that list too.  Bring your questions and your laptops — we look forward to seeing you there.
name: A Beginners Guide to WordPress Plugins

desc:
Freelancing is amazing, but it can be equally difficult when you take the journey alone. Tonight Emily Leach, veteran freelancer, is coming out to talk about some of the most common and difficult issues to overcome as a freelancer.

If sharing 24 years of lessons learned about stabilizing income and balancing life/work weren't enough, there’s more - Emily is also willing to open the floor to questions! Anything you’d like to ask (preferably regarding freelancing). Come out and hear from the Founder of The Freelance Conference and the Texas Freelance Association, she’s also a firecracker, so I know you’ll enjoy this convo/presentation.

Emily Leach

Emily has been called a pioneer in the world of uniquely-talented people who feel empowered to go beyond conventional jobs and create businesses from unique vantage points and perspectives. Her belief that those working for themselves deserve the same respect as those working for major corporations drives her tireless fight to ensure this growing population of “genetically unemployable” solo-preneurs are lifted up and celebrated for their courage and willingness to live their lives according to a new set of rules.

In 2015 the Texas Freelance Association was brought to life as the first statewide association of freelance workers in the country. The inspiration for that project came out of the launch of The Freelance Conference in 2014. Coming up in 2016 is the Freelance Playground and an Ignite Freelance Celebration Tour to acknowledge freelancers for their greatness, and last but not least, Emily's personal podcast… genetically unemployable.

Currently living in Austin, Texas, Emily’s outside interests include rowing, sailing, traveling, scuba diving, snowboarding, whitewater and cycling – basically, having adventures and living life to the fullest.
name: Freelancing: Stabilizing Income, Balancing Work / Life and Open Q&A

desc:
WordPress sites store the vast majority of their data — post content, user information, permalinks, and more—in a MySQL database. This database is stored and accessed quite differently from the main files in the WordPress filesystem (like PHP, JS, and CSS files)—it can even be stored on a different computer.

Ryan Oeltjenbruns will discuss some MySQL tricks, options, and functions available to WordPress developers during our September WPATX Advance WordPress meetup,. Ryan will explore how to “write MySQL” —  to access or change the contents of your WordPress site’s MySQL database.

Although this is an Advance WordPress Developer Level Presentation, we encourage our WordPress Practitioners who are ready to "Put-Your-Code-Pants-On' to attend to pick up some advanced WP back-end tips and tricks. Our great sponsor WP Engine will provide munchies and soft drinks. 

For those who want to continue the conversation, we invite you to the after-meeting code chat, we will be adjourning downstairs to the 'A' bar.
name: MySQL and YOU!

desc:
The weather has been amazing (can you believe it's August?) so let's grab some cold beverages and get together!


It’s time for a social event. Join WP Austin and Pantheon Website Management Platform on Wednesday evening, Sept. 7, at The Gingerman for some great conversation, connections and cold beverages. This is a great opportunity to learn more about some of what Pantheon does, including some of their work around automating WordPress deployments.


We'll see you there!
name: Social get-together with Pantheon

desc:
Just because WordPress is easy to use, does not mean WordPress is easy to maintain, especially from the security point of view. 


Due to their lack of experience in maintaining websites, site security is an ongoing issue for all WordPress Beginners. 

WordPress accounts for more than 25% of sites on the internet. The WordPress extensive ecosystem contains a plethora of plugins and themes — each having the potential for additional security vulnerabilities.

Nick Batik will discuss  the wide variety of reasons that hackers invest their time searching for exploitable vulnerabilities in your simple, low- traffic beginner’s WordPress website. Nick will show our WordPress Beginners how to develop a well-defined process for managing potential vulnerabilities and share the best approach to protect and harden your site against the largest and most common security threats.

We look forward to seeing you there.
name: What Beginners Needs to Know About  Hardening Their WordPress Sites

desc:
Have you ever noticed this?

You looked at a product on a website, and now, you see start seeing ads for that product everywhere else on the web (and/or on Facebook). This is called retargeting. Done properly, retargeting helps you stay in the minds of your site visitors and greatly increases the likelihood of turning them from prospects to customers.

We'll discuss what retargeting is, why you should do it for your ecommerce site and how to set up advertising on Facebook that integrates with products on your WooCommerce website.
name: Facebook Retargeting and Woocommerce

desc:
It is time to ask our WPATX members a very Important question. Should Austin WordPress host a WordCamp in 2017?

Austin has not hosted a WordCamp since 2014. Since then we have had two WordCamp organizers step-up, then for various reasons have had step back from the planning process.

The current WPATX Meet-up Organizers are completely focused on our five monthly meet-ups, and doing one or two, Special Event Days a year.  

If WPATX is ever to have another WordCamp there needs to be a serious discussion amongst the membership about what that means as far as time, talent and treasure — and who is willing to step up, become the WordCamp Organizer, build an organizing team and lead a merry band of volunteers.

For those who are new to WPATX here are some links to explain what to expect when volunteering to lead a WordCamp:

https://central.wordcamp.org/what-to-expect/

https://central.wordcamp.org/become-an-organizer/

https://central.wordcamp.org/

 Bring your ideas and a can-do attitude -We look forward to seeing you there!
name: "What about WordCamp Austin 2017?"

desc: From Subscriber to Administrator, WordPress comes with a variety of roles and capabilities to both grant and restrict access to various functionality within a site.  But what if you need to step outside the defaults?  This talk with plenty of code samples will show you how to create new roles within WordPress, how to create new capabilities and grant roles access, as well as fine-tuning role capabilities using filters.
name: Custom Roles and Capabilities within WordPress

desc:
This is an interactive session for contributing to the opensource work on WordPress. Everyone would bring their laptops and work in flexible groups with any assistance they wanted from me. 

Contributing to opensource work is a great way to learn how to work on a tech team before getting the job. Every time I contribute I work on transferable skills like source control, bug reporting and PHP design patterns to name a few. Its also a really relaxed community, and everyone is super friendly, and really appreciates the effort. 

For people who are new to contributing, we would walk through getting set up and how the process works. 

Practitioners shouldn't think that contributing is just for coders because a big part of the process is verifying tickets by recreating bugs. Their insight would be valuable here. 

Developers who are starting out would have a judgement free zone to ask any questions they have about the development tools needed to contribute. We can also do code reviews as well. 

Experienced contributors are welcome too! During the session, everyone would be welcome to work on what ever tickets they chose. Its not a lecture so people would be welcome to join into the discussion or just do their own thing and hang out.
name: Lets contribute to WordPress! Open to new and experienced contributors.

desc:
Nick and Sandi Batik will lead the October Deep Dive Discussion focusing on the all-too common, and costly issue of project scope creep. The presentation will be geared towards WordPress freelancers, entrepreneurs and digital creatives.


We all understand that it is so easy to get focused on running and maintaining our WordPress businesses, that a few things can slip through the cracks. Ineffective customer on-boarding processes, and client relations management systems are often some of the issues that can lead to scope creep.

What exactly is scope creep, and how  can you keep it from creeping up on you?

We will identify warning signs, how to handle and manage scope creep, and ways to prevent common profit-eating pitfalls.

October's Deep Dive Discussion has be developed for those consultants, freelancers and digital creatives that have been pursuing their WordPress dreams for a while, and would benefit from a refresher about how scope creep can negatively effect your business and what to do about it.
name: Keeping Scope Creep From Creeping Up on You

desc:
The October Austin WordPress Beginner’s class goes back to basics. WPATX has seen membership climb and most of our new members are just that — Folks new to WordPress.


Those of us who teach and mentor can often forget the level of confusion that comes with learning a new language, and no, I’m not talking about PHP or JS. I have been remembering how difficult it was for me to envision and understand what was happening when I was following the “simple instructions”  of setting up and using my first WordPress site.

This WPATX Beginner’s class will be devoted to learning the vocabulary of WordPress, understanding the industry nomenclature that describes just how WordPress does what it does when you tap your keyboard.

The goal of this class is to help our community of WordPress Beginners really understand what is going on behind the screen when you are entering text into your pages and posts and adding plugins.

This session will be lead by Nick and Sandi Batik and has been designed for new users of WordPress and those who have been using WordPress a while and would really like to know, 'How WordPress  Works'. Bring your Laptop and curiosity, We look forward to seeing you there.
name: How WordPress Works

desc:
Hi everyone!

The fall air is fresh and energized in ATX!  It's the perfect time for our WordPress endeavors to be as well!

As stated by WordPress Austin Organizer - Sandi Batik "No matter how many books you read, or online classes you take, being able to ask someone who has already done what you are trying to do is the best way to learn a subject.  This WordPress group is great about sharing knowledge and experience."

Our aim is that the South Austin WordPress Meetup Group will be a safe, inclusive place for everyone.  

Join our speakers and other WordPress users for a moderated discussion on a range of topics.  


This will be a hands on, interactive session.  Bring your laptops, current projects and questions for our panel.

Come out for some small talk, WordPress talk, workshop talk!  Walk away with new ideas and feeling inspired!  Hope to see ya'll there!
name: Panel Discussion, Q&A, Hands on Meeting

desc:
This meeting is open to anyone who wants to be on the planning committee for WordCamp Austin 2017. The planning committee is the group of dedicated volunteers who take the lead in organizing and executing the WordCamp.

Let's get together and finalize our first steps to making WordCamp Austin 2017 a reality.

If you can't make it in person we'll have a Google Hangout going in case you want to call in.

We'll meet in the WP Engine offices, specifically the Continental Club meeting room. When you get to the main entrance of WP Engine, follow the signs to the room.

WP Engine
504 Lavaca St. Suite 1000
Austin, TX 78704
name: WCATX17 Planning Committee

desc:
What does success look like, and how do you get there step-by-step? If your idea/project/firm/startup has yet to gain real traction or reach its full potential in terms of profit and purpose, this session is designed for you.


BIO:
Ben Ponder, PhD, is the COO of Siete Family Foods, a fast-growing healthy Mexican food brand - http://sietefoods.com . He is also a Founding Partner at Barcode, a monthly startup workshop serving the Austin CPG (consumer packaged goods) community - http://barcodestartup.com . In the past, he has led a startup accelerator, a chain of pharmacies, a renewable energy company, an educational software company, and a branding and messaging consultancy.

NOTE:
The seating at Build-a-Sign is not the most comfortable. If you have back pain or issues, you might want to bring your own collapsible camping or other chair.
name: Startup Success: A Few Pragmatic Secrets, Recipes, and Hacks

desc:
We are currently planning a multiple day Workshop and WordCamp-like event in Austin, TX for the first weekend of November 2016, Friday, November 4th, 2016 through Saturday, November 5th, 2016

WPEngine is generously providing space, grub, drinks, and other cool stuff.

More details coming as soon as we start nailing individual sessions down and get the schedule finalized. Check out details at: http://podscamp.org/2016/06/14/podscamp/

Day One — Growth Day

We’ll be spending time talking about building Content Types, using Custom Fields, and everything in between / around it. It’s not entirely Pods-specific, so we welcome those who use other plugins to attend so that you may continue growing your knowledge of useful methods and tools.

This is a day designed around getting someone who may have just installed WordPress familiar enough to build a website with many different types of content and relationships. There will be sessions to start the day, followed by one-on-one with our team members to help reinforce that knowledge and answer any questions you might have.

Day Two — Exploration Day

This day will feature multiple topics about using content types and fields for many different purposes, including walking through building a project from start to finish with many different features, integrating with multiple plugins, and scaling with large amounts of data.

Thanks to our generous sponsor, WP Engine, you can pick up tickets for this great event for only $25!

http://podscamp.org/tickets/

Follow us at @podsframework or tag your tweet with #podscamp!

REGISTER AT:  http://podscamp.org/tickets/

NOT ON THIS PAGE - Thanks
name: PodsCamp Austin 2016

desc:
This month’s Deep Dive Discussion will feature how effective project management can help WordPress Freelancers Improve their bottom line. Mastering basic project management skills can make the difference between managing your Freelance WordPress business or your clients running you ragged.


Nick and Sandi Batik will share project management tips to help Freelancers deliver WordPress projects with a greater likelihood of giving their clients what they wanted when they wanted it. Good project management skills help ensure efficient and best use of resources while managing the expectations of the various project’s stakeholders.

We look forward to seeing you there, bring your lap and WordPress project management questions.
name: What Do Freelancers Need to Know About Project Management?

desc:
Get ready for the WordPress - 3rd Wednesdays Workshop! 

WordPress users of all skill levels should attend!

Bring your laptop fully charged and don’t forget to prepare with questions you would like to get answered.  Let’s come together and discuss these topics further. 

We’ll spend the first hour asking questions and sharing knowledge and information with our fellow WordPress consultants and WordPress users. 

Following the Q&A we will have an open workshop portion – we will open up our WordPress websites and blogs and get to work!

With so much information coming at us in this day and age, it can be challenging to know which resources are reliable and solid.  If you have found a particular resource to be especially helpful, please bring that to share with the community.

We will have a business information exchange.  If you'd like to share your consulting or business name and contact info, we'll write it on the board, so that people can take note and contact you.  We'll also have a spot where business cards can be placed.  

The South Austin WordPress meetup group is all about community -- we are looking forward to seeing you at the meeting!!
name: South Austin WordPress - 3rd Wednesdays Workshop

desc:
Our November Austin WordPress Beginner’s class continues our “Back to WordPress Basics” series. WPATX has seen our membership climb this past year and most of our new members are new to WordPress. The questions our new members are asking have reminded the WPATX organizers of the level of conceptual confusion that we all felt when trying to envision and understand what the various aspects of WordPress were doing and why.


This WPATX Beginner’s class will be devoted to learning the vocabulary and structure of WordPress themes. The goal of this class is to help our community of WordPress Beginners really understand what a WordPress Theme does, and how it does it. 

This session will be lead by Nick and Sandi Batik and has been designed for new users of WordPress and those who have been using WordPress a while and would really like to know, 'How WordPress Themes Work’. Bring your Laptop and curiosity. We look forward to seeing you there.
name: How WordPress Themes Work

desc:
There is a new WordPress Meetup series on the block, one that focuses on the content that goes onto our WordPress websites.

This is for anyone interested in learning about content for their website, starting with content creation, optimization and more.

It takes place the second Tuesday of each month and will launch in January. We are holding a planning session this month. It'll be an open room so people can let us know what topics and formats they’re most interested in seeing.

We are being hosted by T-Werx, a brand new co-working space in Cedar Park. It's a perfect place for folks in North Austin, Leander, Cedar Park, Pflugerville, Round Rock etc. to attend and get involved in our wonderful WordPress group. There will be some seats set aside for members of the co-working space to attend and participate in these meetings.

We will be sending out a Questionnaire to be a conversation starter prior to this meeting. Any feedback would be helpful so we know how to make this meetup as useful to you as possible.

Feel free to arrive early and leave late. We have the room starting at 6:30 to allow time for networking.
name: North WP Content Collective: Planning Session

desc:
THIS CLASS HAS BEEN CANCELLED - RYAN IS ILL 

Ryan Hoover will lead the December Advance WordPress Developer meetup.  Multisite has been  a hot topic with WPATX members, and there have been several requests for more information about how WPATX Devs can offer multisite to our clients.


Here what most of us know — WordPress introduced their multisite feature back in 2010 in WordPress 3.0.It is a powerful WordPress feature that can be used by small, medium, and large websites. It lets you create multiple virtual web sites from one WordPress installation, that allows you turn your website into a network of websites. With one main installation, you only have to update WordPress, and your themes and plugins, once. Multisite gives you access to all network websites directly through the WordPress admin bar.

Ryan will give share his insight about what a Multisite is from the admin's perspective.  Looking at what is a Multisite from the backend perspective. He will show off some cool possibilities of Multisites, Mutiple networks, multiple domains, parent/child sites, templates and close out the session with a Q & A

Ryan is a full stack developer at WP Engine, where he manages the company's websites and builds quirky plugins. He  specializes in WordPress, API integration, automation, and website speed optimization. Ryan is a co-organizer of the Austin WordPress meetup and the organizer of  the 2016 WordCamp Austin. You can follow Ryan at @RhetorRyan
name: CANCELLED What You Need To Know About WordPress Multisite

desc:
Seating is Limited, Please Register Here: https://generalassemb.ly/education/fresh-to-design-ga-present-break-into-ux-design/austin/19304

Want to be a UX Designer or new to UX Design? Curious about how the role differs depending on where you work?
Join us for a panel to learn more about what a UX Designer does day-to-day and what skills you’ll need to be successful in the field. 

Come to hear the stories of inspiring designers, and stay to connect with a community of new and aspiring UX practitioners. Join us for drinks and networking after.

Moderator:
Kristy Okada

Panelists:
Nichole Burton
Anthony Reyes
Mae Reed
Jeff Keen
name: Fresh To Design + GA Present: Break Into UX Design

desc:
This is a FREE Event but seating is limited, please register here: https://generalassemb.ly/education/the-modern-resume-how-to-stand-out-in-todays-job-market/austin/19735

The job market is an ever changing environment, and consequently, new trends are beginning to emerge in resume format and content. In the competitive Austin market, it is important to submit cohesive, thoughtful and clean looking resumes to set yourself apart and stand out from other applicants. In this workshop, we'll focus on modern resume best practices in both content and format. We'll deep dive into trends in wording, design, and creating your personal narrative that best displays your transferable skills. We'll also address the do's and don'ts as well as common myths when restructuring your resume.

This workshop would benefit career changers, recent grads, or anyone returning to the job hunt after years in the same position/field.

Students will be able to:
Explain how their skills are transferable into relevant job-seeking experience.
Write/Reword content for a current professional resume.
Format their resume appropriately for their intended field.
name: The Modern Resume: How To Stand Out In Today's Job Market

desc:
**NOTE: This is a FREE event. Reserve your spot at https://generalassemb.ly/education/ga-atx-happy-hour/austin/19536

About This Event

Come celebrate the end of the work week with your pals at GA. Drinks are on us, so stop by for mingling, beverages, & great conversation with our students, instructors, and the movers & shakers of Austin's tech, business and design community. 

Refund Policy

Plans change. We get it. But if you can't make it to a class/workshop, please email us at least 7 days before the scheduled event date. No refunds will be given after this timeframe.
name: Happy Hour

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/digital-marketing-bootcamp--2/austin/19506

This interactive, activity driven class will enable you to reach and engage your audience in your organizational space. You will then identify how to track and drive them toward relevant conversion points and KPIs.

Takeaways
- Solid understanding of who your customers are and how to reach them online;
- How to use Metrics and Analytics to quantify results;
- How to develop a content marketing strategy to effectively reach and retain your customers; and
- Learn how to acquire new customers and retain current customers through social media, paid advertising, email and search engine marketing.

Prereqs & Preparation
- Laptop
- Project/company that you want to focus on for the bootcamp
- Brand documents (including elevator speech, example of the website), if you have them
- Organizational goals and/or opportunities
name: Digital Marketing Bootcamp

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/introduction-to-product-management-workshop/austin/19379

Companies are full of ideas, but how do you know which are worth working on? In the first half of the workshop, you’ll learn how to use the MVP (Minimum Viable Product) philosophy to test and validate your ideas to get the best fit for your market while undertaking the least risk. In the second portion of the workshop you’ll learn how to identify the right metrics and KPIs to guide your product to continued success. Since poducts are constantly evolving even after launching, being able to measure your product’s progress is critical to the ultimate success of your product and your company.

Takeaways:
- Understand the MVP philosophy and learn to apply it to your own
- Learn how to test your ideas and assumptions to ensure that your new product or feature set meets your customers' needs
- Identify KPIs in order to track progress over time and tie new features to what is important to your business

Prereqs & Preparation: Please bring a laptop.
name: Introduction To Product Management Workshop

desc: Dash is the easiest tool to learn HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Come meet and work alongside other hackers in the making as we navigate our way through fun online tutorials. You'll walk away with a better understanding of front-end web development and will meet like-minded friends who are also new to code. You'll also build something awesome along the way. This will be a casual, self-paced session with pizza and beer.
name: Dine and Dash And Code For Beginners

desc:
NOTE: This is a FREE event. Please RSVP at this link to reserve your spot: http://ga.co/1HpLQvC

About This Event

General Assembly invites you to meet the 11 graduates of our User Experience Design Immersive on Wednesday, January 13. Our talented graduates have spent the last ten weeks – all day, every day immersed in this program and are eager to chat with you about Junior UX Designer opportunities. We teach core skills that make up the entire user experience design process. From research and ideation to prototyping and testing, our user experience design training teaches students how to solve design problems using proven skills and methods.

desc:
NOTE: This is a FREE event. Please RSVP at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/general-assembly-open-house-your-year-of-yes/austin/19892

It starts now. Swing by our local open house, and find out how GA can help you say "yes" to a more fulfilling career in 2016.


Info Sessions
Find out about our full- and part-time courses from our admissions team, and ask them all your burning questions.

desc:
Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/sql-bootcamp/austin/19673


Structured Query Language (SQL) is a standardized and interactive programming language for retrieving information from, as well as, updating information within databases. SQL is both an American National Standards Institute (ANSI) and an International Organization for Standardization (ISO) standard. Knowledge and proficiency in SQL provides a powerful but reasonably simple tool set for data analysis, data mining and data reporting. This bootcamp will take beginners through the basics of SQL giving them the ability to write queries with confidence. We will use a combination of lecture and in-class exercises to ensure that students leave with a working foundation of SQL fundamentals.
name: SQL Bootcamp

This session, designed for the beginner programmer, will assume no previous coding knowledge. We'll go over key coding terminology and principles, introduce languages like HTML and CSS—what their functions are, how they work together—and use that new knowledge to write our own code and develop our own simple site.

desc:
Note: This is a free event, Please register here:
https://generalassemb.ly/education/combatting-imposter-syndrome/austin/21252

The more we know, the less we think we know; this is a common phenomenon experienced by those acquiring new skills. Imposter Syndrome is behavior stemming from the belief that, despite proof otherwise, we are vocational imposters and frauds, and that we have been duped by our own rationalized thoughts into believing that we overstate skills that we don’t actually possess. By using Inquiry to dissolve these false thoughts and their underlying beliefs leading to the discovery and proof of truth, we can live fully and authentically in the freedom to embrace our passion and enthusiastically present to the world our fully-qualified professional selves.
Learn to identify and define Imposter Syndrome, distinguish between the social self and the essential self, identify fraudulent thoughts, test them against the truth, and assess the physical and emotional response to fraudulent thoughts through confirmation of truth.
name: Combatting Imposter Syndrome

*Note: This is a free event. Please be sure to register: http://ga.co/1QPdBE5*

This workshop is for you if you are ready to take control of your career. Learn to leverage the power of the ultimate job search tool, LinkedIn, a platform that boasts 332+ million users and is used by 93% of recruiters.

In this workshop, you will learn how to develop and maintain a strong LinkedIn profile that includes a work portfolio, a powerful Summary that lets your personality shine through, and a results oriented Experience section. ​A good LinkedIn profile can serve as a combination resume, bio and brochure on who you are and why you matter professionally. ​You will also learn how to develop an ongoing engagement with LinkedIn community using status updates, LinkedIn publishing platform and groups.

The workshop is equally relevant for job seekers and career changers.

Takeaways
- Have a completed, personalized LinkedIn to do list
- Learn key LinkedIn concepts and strategies
- Learn the tools and techniques for crafting a results-oriented profile
- Understand the power of “recommendations” and how to use them
​- Start building your ​professional brand ​
- How to optimize your privacy settings and your personal profile for maximum exposure and discoverability
- Permitting there is time after the Q&A, ​we'll have a working session where you can ask questions and get feedback from the instructors.

Prereqs & Preparation
​An o​pen mind and a desire to succeed​. Bring a writing utensil and paper for notes and laptop/tablet for working session (if there is time).

About the Instructor
Nicole Hartig, Outcomes Producer + Career Coach, General Assembly
After graduating from Loras College with a Bachelors in Business Administration, Nicole moved to Austin, TX. She spent the last 3.5 years working for a software development company doing everything from running the daily operations of the office to recruitment, interviewing and onboarding of new employees. Currently, Nicole is our Outcomes Producer + Career Coach at General Assembly ATX. She supports graduates of the immersive programs as they transition into the next phase of their professional lives; helping them get connected to new opportunities, and providing them with career service support. She also works to develop meaningful relationships with companies in town.
name: Improve Your LinkedIn Profile to Succeed in 2016

- Easy ways to get your foot in the door.
- How to prepare for a Product Manager interview?

About the Instructor
Dan Corbin, Product Manager, Return Path
Dan Corbin is the Product Manager for Context.IO (a Return Path company). He is a Certified Scrum Product Owner and a Certified Scrum Professional with over 15 years of product development, project management, and programming experience. He has overseen the development and launched a number of API, web application, and SaaS products.
As the co-organizer of the Agile Austin Product SIG and a frequent contributor to other local meetups, Dan is an active member of the Austin Product Management community. Topics of his presentations have included managing backlogs, utilizing metrics, risk-mitigation, Agile story writing workshops, assessing products with the opportunity canvas, and the using the happiness metric to improve team productivity. He is also an instructor for Agile Austin U which teaches Scrum and Agile fundamentals.

In this session, we will discuss the basics of APIs: what they are, how they work, and why they matter. desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/visual-design-fundamentals/austin/21770

About This Class

The goal of visual design is to communicate a specific message to a targeted audience. Through the intentional and aesthetic manipulation of elements, one is able to influence and inspire. Color theory, layout and typography are among the many areas covered in this course, as well as common practices, such as creative briefs and approval processes.
By mastering the basic principles of design, you can be confident that your creativity and effort is effective. And everyone is happy.

Takeaways

A vocabulary for critique and communicating visual problems and solutions.
A toolkit for exploration while starting new projects.
Understand the purpose of visual design and the value it brings to the overall experience
Provide a background of key visual design elements and components
Start to identify aspects that make certain UI’s work (or not work)
Learn how to look at UI’s in a more critical lens

Prereqs & Preparation

This class is for UX Designers looking to get more of a background on Visual Design or Digital Marketers interested in learning visual design essentials to create own ads and marketing collateral.
name: Visual Design Fundamentals

The first step in turning an idea into reality is to understand product management. Saying, "All I need is a tech team" is a bit like saying, "I want to construct a building from the ground up and all I need is a construction crew." There is a huge amount of work between the idea stage and the coding stage, and this workshop will help you understand what needs to be accomplished.
Schedule: - Is Your Idea Worth Working On? - What Features Should Your Product Have? - How Will Your Product Be Built?

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/fundamentals-of-design-research/austin/20698

About This Class

This course will provide a brief yet in-depth foray into the fundamentals of design research. Attendees will learn the value of understanding users and user groups while discovering design research’s ability to inform design directions, structure ideation and inform interaction. This class is specifically tailored to thinking about design research as it pertains to the greater design process as opposed to as an isolated field of work.

Calling all business owners interested in expanding markets and understanding your users, or designers who may be unfamiliar, unpracticed, or doubtful of design research! Throughout this workshop, students will learn a variety of design research methodologies based on context and project scope as well as tips and tricks for how to conduct them properly. They’ll tease out how to find the “needle in the haystack” in their findings and to begin the abductive process of synthesis. Lastly, they'll explore different approaches for codifying findings to ensure they continue on throughout the design process.

Takeaways

Learn effective qualitative design research methodologies for greater understanding depending on context and project scope
Learn best practices in preparing and conducting aforementioned research methodologies
Understand how to set up successful synthesis of findings
Leave with frameworks for choosing and employing research methodologies

Prereqs & Preparation

Basic understanding of design thinking.
Please bring paper/pen and a laptop.
name: Fundamentals of Design Research

About This Class

If you’ve ever been asked to write copy on an impossible deadline, or to fill a wireframe with the right amount of copy to make a design "look good," your organization may benefit from a strategic approach to content. Join us as we discuss what content strategy is, how it relates to the user experience, and how it differs from content marketing.
You’ll learn how to include content strategy in your user experience design process.
You’ll learn how your organization’s overall strategy affects your content efforts, and how to include content strategy in your user experience design process.

Takeaways

Identify 3 key elements of usable content
Create an audit that will help you assess your site’s content needs—and convince your stakeholders to help, too
Get resources that can help you start fixing your organization’s most pressing content problems

Prereqs & Preparation

Bring your laptop :)
name: Getting Started with Content Strategy

Join General Assembly and SXSW at the AT&T Conference Center on Friday, March 11, Saturday, March 12 and Sunday, March 13 for classes in web development, digital marketing, business development, user experience design, and more. You'll learn new skills from seasoned practitioners and leave with the know-how to meet the next milestone in your professional life. 


These events are FREE - you do not need a SXSW badge to attend (although badgeholders are also welcome). Click on a session below to sign up!

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/intro-to-android-development/austin/20529

About This Class

A lot of us have had ideas for great apps bouncing around in our brains, but lack the skills necessary to bring our ideas to life. With Android holding more than 80% of the current marketshare, the ability to make Anroid-friendly apps is in high demand. Whether you’re a novice techie, an entrepreneur, or just an Android phone owner, in this class you’ll learn all about the basic building blocks of making an Android App.

Takeaways

• Learn how Android apps work with the Android operating system

• Getting started with Android StudioBasic

• Android design guidelines

• What tools are needed to start Android development

Prereqs & Preparation

Basic understanding of XML and Java (can attend without Java knowledge, but it will help understanding and what you can do next).

Please bring a laptop with:

• The most up to date version of Android Studio: http://developer.android.com/sdk/index.htmlthis can take some time to download/setup but is pretty straightforward. Students will need to make sure to handle this before they get into the classroom

• The most up to date version of Java (Android Studio will prompt you to a download page if you don’t have it)

• Android Emulator set-up via Android Studio or an Android phone
name: Intro to Android Development

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/the-art-of-persuasive-communication-to-increase-sales/austin/23023

About This Workshop

In this day long workshop, created for sales teams and managers, we'll cover:

- Audience Analysis: How can we design our messages to connect with different audiences and increase persuasion?

- Interpersonal Communication: How does listening and conversational style affect customer relationships and persuasion?

- Message Organization and Delivery: How can effective message organization and delivery increase persuasion?

- Storytelling: How can communicating a story effectively promote brand awareness and increase message persuasion?

Takeaways • Apply three methods of audience analysis for designing effective persuasive messages

• Diagnose individual listening style and improve interpersonal communication skills for maximizing customer relationships

• Understand how message organization and delivery can increase or decrease persuasion

• Clarify the relationship between successful branding and effective storytelling to drive customer persuasion
name: The Art of Persuasive Communication to Increase Sales

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/programming-for-non-programmers-bootcamp/austin/21227

About This Workshop Series

Are you a creative or entrepreneur that wishes you could speak tech with your web development team? Maybe you wish you could code a bit yourself? Programming for Non-Programmers is workshop series at General Assembly designed to help non-programmers communicate more efficiently with developers or to help aspiring developers get started.

Saturday, 26 March 10 am – 5 pm CDT

Session I: Internet Fundamentals & Front-end Development


You will be introduced to a broad overview of programming and learn the following along the way:

• A brief history of the internet

• The response and request cycle

• How browsers, domain names and URLs work

• Front-end vs back-end development

• A quick look at transfer protocols

• A word on code editors

• The importance file paths

• File formats 101

• Naming conventions and project organization

• Building a basic web site

• Up and running with hypertext markup language (HTML)

• Styling with cascading style sheets

• Adding behavior with JavaScript

• Uploading your site to a web server

Sunday, 27 March 10 am – 5 pm CDT

Session II: Web Apps & Back-end Development


You will be introduced to back-end technologies and learn the following along the way...

• The distinction between client and server


• Popular web applications

• What are databases and how do they work?

• Learning the basic HTTP verbs

• Exploring forms

• Authentication and security

• Cookies and sessions

• The proliferation of frameworks

• Source control

• Creating a web app

• Functional specifications

• Setting up a “stack”

• Hello world!

• Creating a todo list application

• The Model View Controller pattern

• Getting data back and forth

• Deployment

Prereqs & Preparation

• Please bring a laptop to class with Sublime Text downloaded.

• Sessions can be taken together or individually but must be taken in order. Ie - Programming for Non-Programmers Session I is a pre-req for Session II and Session III.
name: Programming for Non-Programmers Bootcamp

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/social-media-strategy-mapping/austin/21298

About This Class

Social media initiatives don’t start when you register a Facebook or Twitter account and start posting announcements, it begins much sooner. In this workshop, you’ll be taken through a 6-step methodology that will help guide your efforts to develop an actionable social media strategy. You’ll learn how to structure your social media efforts, deploy your resources, and ultimately launch a social media campaign that is professional and provides results you’ll be able to interpret and understand.

Takeaways

• Learn how to develop and implement a social media strategy.

• Create an elevator pitch that clearly defines your brand, audience, and key differentiator.

• Define and track the KPIs most relevant to your business.

• Describe the different between major social media platforms.

• Identify which platforms to use for your business.

• Explain the difference between publishing, listening, and reporting tools.

• Create a weekly content calendar for your business.

Prereqs & Preparation

None! Please bring a laptop to class, along with a notepad and pen.
name: Social Media Strategy Mapping

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/intro-to-ruby-on-rails-workshop--2/austin/21297

About This Workshop

Ruby On Rails is one of the hottest ways to develop the next big thing, as proven by Twitter, Hulu and Groupon. This class will provide an introduction to becoming a Ruby on Rails developer. Learn about the fundamentals of programming for the web, the required toolset and where to go next.

In this class, we will cover:

• An introduction to the web stack - explaining what happens on the server and client when you visit a web page in your browser

• What is Ruby on Rails, and where does it fit into the web stack?

• A brief introduction to programming and the Ruby programming language

• A high level overview of the rails framework - explaining the M, V, and C of MVC

• Ruby package management - bundler and gems - installing rails

• Hello World - your first rails app

• Adding some interaction - taking user input via a form

• Persisting data - using models to interact with a database

• Deploying your first app with Heroku
name: Intro to Ruby on Rails Workshop

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/harnessing-the-power-of-branding-to-drive-deep-emotional-connections-with-customers/austin/22184

About This Class

Strong brands help their customers solve problems, present a positive image to the world, feel empowered, feel accomplished, and feel like the hero in their own personal stories. Think about what happens when you’re feeling like you’re on top of the world, and everything is working out the way you hoped it would. No matter which cliché you use to describe it--the feeling of having wind in your sails or the world on a string--that feeling connects deeply with your emotions.

Sol Marketing CEO and Brand Dominatrix Deb Gabor puts you in the mood to create a powerful brand that connects with your most important customers -- the ones who are most highly predictive of your success.

This practical, hands-on session will cover the following topics in a lively and entertaining way:
Define what is a “brand”
Understand the importance of branding for informing business strategies
Learn the foundations of brand strategy
Gain insight into why even B2B and hard-core technology companies need brands
Assess the timing for engaging in branding activities
How-to: roll up your sleeves and create the foundation for your company's or your own personal brand
In true General Assembly ATX-style, the session is structured like a workshop and relies upon pairing attendees off to practice some key brand strategy “hacks” together.
name: Harnessing Brand Power to Drive Deep Emotional Connections with Customers

desc:
Please note this is a free event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/beyond-the-resume/austin/22648

About This Event

Beyond the Resume will cover the ins and outs of what it takes to stand out as a top level candidate with step by step guidance on how to take your professional persona to the next level.

Part One: What It Means To Think Outside The Box When It Comes To Getting A Job - Tips on how to put yourself out there - Getting comfortable talking about yourself - Your personal elevator pitch - The art of finding common ground with someone you just met

Part Two: The In-Person connection - How to find the best networking opportunities - In-person networking etiquette - The follow up

Part Three: The Digital Connection - Channel strategy (how to use each social channel to your advantage when looking for a job) - Digital networking etiquette - How to reach out to a complete stranger online
name: Beyond the Resume

desc:
Please note this is a free event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/sports-analytics-final-four-edition/austin/22248


About This Event

Ever seen the movie Moneyball and wondered exactly what Jonah Hill did to make the A’s such a good baseball team? Can you ever imagine a football team that NEVER punts the football? What about never kicking extra points? Ever wanted to prove the Duke really does get ALL the calls? And you’ll never believe who the Denver Broncos have on the headset with their coach during games!

The “Moneyball Effect” has become more and more prevalent in sports over the past decade. Teams are hiring entire teams of Analytics professionals to give them an added edge on the field and at the ticket office. Join us for an event that dives into the field of Sports Analytics, and uncover some of the ways teams are using data to win. Who knows, maybe you’ll even pick up a helpful tip for your Final Four predictions. 

Topics to cover include (subject to change): - The advent of Sports Analytics … where are we going next - Predicting the NCAA basketball tournament using Ken Pomeroy’s Pythagorean rating - A look into NBA SportVu data and how teams are leveraging it - Extra Points in the NFL, are they worth it anymore?


We’ll have a presentation and some interactive activities to help you pick your personal brackets as well as the sports standards: pizza and beer!
name: Sports Analytics: Final Four Edition

Topics will include data manipulation/troubleshooting and advanced functions to summarize and analyze data having multiple attributes. We will also introduce Pivot Tables, advanced graphs, and macros. Class exercises will be utilized to facilitate understanding.

Prereqs & Preparation • A basic understanding of the Excel spreadsheet layout and Pivot Tables

• Common uses such as entering data into a blank spreadsheet and copying/pasting

• An understanding of common functions such as SUM, IF, and VLOOKUP

• Ability to create a graph from two or more sets of data points

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/sql-bootcamp/austin/22418

About This Workshop

SQL provides powerful but reasonably simple tools for data analysis and handling. This bootcamp will take absolute beginners through the basics of SQL to an ability to write queries with confidence. We will use a combination of lecture and in-class exercises to ensure that students leave with a working grasp of SQL fundamentals.

Takeaways • Background on SQL

• Basic SELECT-FROM-WHERE statements

• LIMIT clauses

• Math operations and constant expressions in SELECT statements

• Booleans and complex conditions in the WHERE clause

• Pattern matching in the WHERE clause

• NULL values

• JOIN operations

• Grouping and aggregations

• HAVING clauses

• ORDER BY clauses

• Subqueries

Prereqs & Preparation

Basic technical aptitude and orientation to computers, and curiosity to learn new tools. Willingness to learn about a text-based/principle driven analytic tool with little real GUI support, and determination to push through the natural frustration of confronting new concepts.

We will be pausing to let students run and write queries of their own, so students should bring laptops with an installed SQL implementation (SQLlite,MySQL, Postgres, SQL Server; Access is strongly discouraged). Instructions for installing MySQL will be distributed prior to class.
name: SQL Bootcamp

Usability testing
Varying testing methods and their purposes
Test recruitment and planning
Facilitation skills
Writing your testing guide
Synthesizing, presenting and implementing results

Takeaways

You’ll learn: -Why user test? -Which types of usability testing to use and when each are appropriate -How to recruit participants (paid and unpaid) -Tips for facilitating user testing -Tips for successful testing protocols -How to document and present your findings for clients or peers

Prereqs & Preparation

This class is for junior level Interaction designers, or any UX Designers not yet comfortable with or experienced with running usability testing.
name: UX: Usability & User Testing

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/introduction-to-google-analytics/austin/22337

About This Class

Google Analytics is an incredibly robust, free tool for measuring web traffic data. In this class, you’ll get to know the basics of using Google Analytics to track and evaluate performance and draw insights to improve your business. Starting with basic terminology and key metrics, you’ll build a foundation of knowledge before diving deeper into more complex analytics techniques, including advertising tracking and custom segments. You’ll walk away with a fundamental understanding of Google Analytics’ role in running and operating your business.

Takeaways • Learn the basic setup, navigation, and interface of Google Analytics

• Get acquainted with basic terminology and mathematical formulas to understand key metrics

• Be able to identify the metrics that matter for your specific business case and how to use them to make educated decisions

• Create custom segments, goals, URLs, and dashboards

• Create automated alerts and scheduled reportsLearn to identify exceptions and surface actionable insights

• Export data for further analysis in Excel

• Design useful charts for sharing with colleagues or clients

Prereqs & Preparation

It would be useful to have a basic understanding of Excel, but we will cover it in class as well. Laptops are welcomed but not necessary.
name: Introduction to Google Analytics

About This Class

95% of the information on the web is written language. Type is likely to be your users first point of contact with your brand, interface or marketing message. In the race for people's attention the details matter and the details start with type.

Studies have demonstrated that when type is set well, it improves the mood, comprehension, and cognitive skills of the reader. As a result, increasing numbers of executives and entrepreneurs are realizing that typography matters to their brand, their customers, and their success.
Students will receive a hands-on introduction to what typography is, why it matters, and several key features of good typography. Through a blend of lecture slides and practical exercises, students will learn to see typography with a critical eye and leave having learnt to make better choices about their own work, whether in branding decisions, user experience, or just crafting a new résumé.
Prereqs & Preparation

No prior knowledge of design theory is assumed.
name: Using Typography to Improve Design and User Experience

About This Workshop

Python is a versatile and widely-used programming language with many applications. This workshop explores Python's place in the scientific ecosystem, and how the language, with several readily-available open-source libraries, can serve as a powerful tool for data analysis. Designed as a stand-alone introduction to the data science aspects of Python, this class is also a recommended refresher for students planning to enroll in General Assembly's upcoming Data Science course. The course is hands-on and exercise based, so students will get plenty of practice.

Takeaways

Ability to write and run Python scripts
Ability to use Python for basic data analysis tasks (data cleaning and reformatting, exploration, analysis)
Understanding of Python’s role as a tool in the backend and analysis toolkits
Understanding of the possibilities opened up through a better understanding of Python

Prereqs & Preparation

General technical savvy, and comfort with computers
Some prior experience with use of computers for analysis or repetitive tasks – such as Excel
Installation of Anaconda for Python 2.7, which is a free distribution of python that includes libraries of open source python tools (http://continuum.io/downloads).
name: Intro to Python Bootcamp

About This Workshop

Using design thinking methods developed by David Kelly at the Stanford d.School, learn how to make faster, better design decisions by putting the customer first. Design Thinking is based on a series of Steps: Empathy, Definition, Ideation, Prototyping and Testing. And a set of Mindsets: Human Centered, Bias Towards Action, Show Don't Tell, Radical Collaboration, Culture of Prototyping and Mindful of Process. We will touch on each of these during the Crash Course.

Takeaways

Learn the five steps of the design thinking process: empathy, ideation, prototyping, testing and iteration to practice design thinking on your own projects
Gain resources to dive deeper in design thinking

Prereqs & Preparation

Be prepared with Curiosity, Honesty and Self-awareness or a desire for more
name: Design Thinking Crash Course

We’ll hear from three successful individuals on these different paths doing just that. They’ll share their personal stories along with proven strategies to finding mentors, building a resume, networking with others in the industry, and becoming a better technologist.

Takeaways

Move past the junior level by establishing a solid reputation, connections and skills within the tech community.
name: How to Engineer Your Tech Career

About This Workshop

The digital landscape is moving at lightning speed. Every industry has been affected by the advances in digital—from retail to brands and agencies. Has your manager recently assigned a digital marketing role to you? Are you a project or account manager at a creative agency? Do you work for a small company or a start-up, and handle all things digital on your own? Then this bootcamp may be just what you need! Specifically created for students and professionals interested in gaining a deeper understanding of everything digital marketing can encompass.

This activity-driven class will equip you with tips and strategies on how to devise your brand and marketing strategy, what digital channels are available to you and how to use them, and how to track and analyze all of your marketing efforts with data-driven decisions.

Takeaways

Learn how to create a basic brand/marketing strategy
List and execute at least 5 key best practices on content marketing
Identify and describe at least 3 marketing techniques for each channel
Walk away with examples of KPIs and metrics to track

Prereqs & Preparation

Laptop or at the very least a notepad and pen
Project/company that you want to focus on during the exercises portion

About This Class

Product Management: the process of working with designers and developers to successfully build and launch digital products. In this class, we introduce you to the key product management concepts. Learn how to analyze the market, flesh out your ideas, identify risks, and validate assumptions. We’ll also touch on the post-launch process of tracking performance, prioritizing development of new features, and managing stakeholders.

Whether you're considering a career in product management or launching your own digital product, you will need to draw on a diverse range of skills to determine viability and to plan out a road map to long-term product success. Start developing those skills today!

Takeaways

Define the multiple roles & responsibilities of a Product Manager
Understand how customer needs translate into features of a product
Identify the underlying risks and assumptions associated with new features
Gain an understanding of the product development cycle
name: Introduction to Product Management

About This Class

In today's environment, with the easy and low-cost availability of technology, the startup world has been turned on its head. No longer is it acceptable to prepare a 60-page business plan in isolation, then spend all your time and money to see if you got it right. The lean methodology allows you to quickly develop and test many ideas, allowing you to commit resources only after you have maximized your chances of success.

Takeaways

The Lean Canvas:Creating a business model for your startup idea.
Value Proposition: How to make something your customers will buy.
MVP: Creating a Minimum Viable Product

Prereqs & Preparation

desc:
NOTE: This is a PAID workshop. Please register at this link to reserve your spot:

https://generalassemb.ly/education/designing-for-lasting-impact-the-role-of-culture-context/austin/23700

Culture is an inherent and critical element in effecting positive behavior change. Too often, though, it’s overlooked throughout design and development, jeopardizing potential impact.
Understanding how cultural nuance can affect user experience—of products, services, or public policy—can inform more long-lasting, impactful design. In this two-hour workshop, designer and researcher David Schwartz will explore methodologies for analyzing the tangible and intangible aspects of culture that have proven to be encompassing factors of effective design and implementation decisions.
This workshop will be valuable for anyone creating or working with people—designers and non-designers alike—including entrepreneurs, policymakers, and all others dedicated to the pursuit of social impact.
name: Designing For Lasting Impact: The Role of Culture & Context
