About This Class

For those who have already been introduced to the basics in the field of Project Management, this class will take your skills to the next level. The class will focus on specific techniques to properly scope and estimate projects in your business.

Takeaways

How to develop project scope based on an initial request from a client/stakeholder
How to gather/generate estimates - different methods of estimating, getting good estimates from your team, and how to plan for the unknown
Synthesizing estimates and figuring out if time, resources or budget need to recalibrated

Prereqs & Preparation

Project Management 101 taught by Christine Holcombe recommended (not required)
Basic understanding of the digital project lifecycle
Bring questions and real-world examples or problems
name: Advanced Project Management: Scoping and Estimating Projects

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/introduction-to-google-analytics/austin/27922

About This Class

Google Analytics is an incredibly robust, free tool for measuring web traffic data. In this class, you’ll get to know the basics of using Google Analytics to track and evaluate performance and draw insights to improve your business. Starting with basic terminology and key metrics, you’ll build a foundation of knowledge before diving deeper into more complex analytics techniques, including advertising tracking and custom segments. You’ll walk away with a fundamental understanding of Google Analytics’ role in running and operating your business.

Takeaways

Learn the basic setup, navigation, and interface of Google Analytics
Get acquainted with basic terminology and mathematical formulas to understand key metrics
Be able to identify the metrics that matter for your specific business case and how to use them to make educated decisions
Create custom segments, goals, URLs, and dashboards
Create automated alerts and scheduled reports
Learn to identify exceptions and surface actionable insights
Export data for further analysis in Excel
Design useful charts for sharing with colleagues or clients

Prereqs & Preparation

It would be useful to have a basic understanding of Excel, but we will cover it in class as well. Laptops are welcomed but not necessary.
name: Introduction to Google Analytics

Prereqs & Preparation

Must bring your digital portfolio on a laptop, or have a section of it physically in hand to have reviewed!

About This Workshop

Using design thinking methods developed by David Kelly at the Stanford d.School, learn how to make faster, better design decisions by putting the customer first. Design Thinking is based on a series of Steps: Empathy, Definition, Ideation, Prototyping and Testing. And a set of Mindsets: Human Centered, Bias Towards Action, Show Don't Tell, Radical Collaboration, Culture of Prototyping and Mindful of Process. We will touch on each of these during the Crash Course.

Takeaways

Learn the five steps of the design thinking process: empathy, ideation, prototyping, testing and iteration to practice design thinking on your own projects
Gain resources to dive deeper in design thinking

Prereqs & Preparation

Be prepared with Curiosity, Honesty and Self-awareness or a desire for more
name: Design Thinking Crash Course

JavaScript has enjoyed tremendous growth over the past few years, both in its utility as a technology and value as a skill in the job market. JavaScript has long been the only programming language that can be run natively in a web browser; it is now also being used to program everything from servers to mobile devices. About This Workshop

You’re full of ideas, but how do you know which are worth working on? In the first half of the workshop, you’ll learn how to use the MVP (Minimum Viable Product) philosophy to test and validate your ideas with the least amount of work required. The ultimate goal is to get to product/market fit. Take your idea and get moving in the right direction quickly and efficiently.

In the second portion of the workshop you’ll learn how to identify the right metrics and KPIs to guide your product to continued success. Products are constantly evolving even after launching. Being able to measure your product’s progress is critical to improving it.

Prereqs & Preparation

None. Please bring a laptop.
name: Product Management Bootcamp

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/social-media-bootcamp/austin/26992

About This Class

In this bootcamp, students will be introduced to the current social media landscape and explore how it can be used for maximum results for brands. Students will leave with a detailed understanding of both the current social media landscape and how to evaluate which social platforms, social marketing techniques, and paid social advertising methods are the best fit for their organization's goals.

We'll cover the following topics: an overview of social media platforms, current social media trends and their implications, how to tailor social media strategy and content to your business, paid social advertising techniques, and social media tools for monitoring and ROI.

Case studies and tactics will be presented throughout the session and students will gain hands on knowledge through breakout sessions.

Takeaways

Overview of social platforms and their strengths for brands
Creating a social media strategy that builds your brand (or optimizing an existing one)
Understanding the basics of paid social advertising to achieve specific business goals
How to measure social success and ROI
Helpful tools for understanding audiences, developing content, and measuring success
Social media trends for 2016

Prereqs & Preparation

Students should have a basic understanding of marketing. Administrative access to brand social accounts preferred, but not required.

Please bring a Laptop.
name: Social Media Bootcamp

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/web-development-immersive-prep/austin/28660

About This Workshop

Interested in transitioning into a career in Web Development? Thinking about enrolling in our Web Development Immersive?
This prep workshop will cover web development fundamentals and an introduction to JavaScript. This workshop is free for students enrolled in the September Web Development Immersive cohort. For students in the enrollment process or interested in applying, the cost of the workshop will go towards your tuition in the program.

For Web Development Immersive Students, this workshop will count towards your pre-work.

Schedule

10 am
Day 1: Web Development Fundamentals

This session will cover:
Intro to Programming
What is programming?
The difference between static web pages and web apps
Front-end vs Back-end development
How the web works
Internet vs web
Web servers and clients
The request/response lifecycle
DNS
Domains and subdomains
Developer Tools
The IDE
Chrome (DevTools)
HTML
Structure and Syntax
Essential HTML tags
Boilerplate HTML
CSS
External stylesheets vs internal styles vs inline styles
Classes and ID’s
Working with fonts
Working with images
The Box Model
Layout with CSS
Command Line
Navigating the command line
Relative vs absolute paths
Creating files and folders
Copying and moving files
Using options and arguments
Git
Initializing a new repository
Tracking changes to code
Staging revisions
Committing code to your local repository
GitHub
Development workflow
Cloning vs forking


10 am
Day 2: JavaScript

This session will cover:
Data types
Operators
Expressions
Variables
Boolean logic
Control flow
Conditionals
Arrays
Iteration with loops
Working with objects
Defining and calling functions
Listening for user driven events
Accessing the DOM
Manipulating the DOM
Writing Pseudocode
name: Web Development Immersive Prep

DESIGN DISRUPTORS reveals a never-before-seen perspective on the design approaches of 15+ industry-shaking companies, and how they’re using the power of design to disrupt billion dollar industries.

Grab a drink, some movie treats, and be first to see the film. Engage in the fireside chat with the local design heroes. Speakers to be confirmed.

Seating is limited—reserve your seat today!
name: "Design Disruptors" Film Screening

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/visual-design-fundamentals/austin/28044

About This Workshop

The goal of visual design is to communicate a specific message to a targeted audience. Through the intentional and aesthetic manipulation of elements, one is able to influence and inspire. Color theory, layout and typography are among the many areas covered in this course, as well as common practices, such as creative briefs and approval processes.
By mastering the basic principles of design, you can be confident that your creativity and effort is effective. And everyone is happy.

Takeaways

A vocabulary for critique and communicating visual problems and solutions.
A toolkit for exploration while starting new projects.
Understand the purpose of visual design and the value it brings to the overall experience
Provide a background of key visual design elements and components
Start to identify aspects that make certain UI’s work (or not work)
Learn how to look at UI’s in a more critical lens

Prereqs & Preparation

This class is for UX Designers looking to get more of a background on Visual Design or Digital Marketers interested in learning visual design essentials to create own ads and marketing collateral.
name: Visual Design Fundamentals

We will discuss the data landscape, what a data role entails, who makes a good Data Scientist, and how to transition into the field. You will understand the many ways companies think about, utilize, and capture data to make smarter and more informed business decisions. Plus, you'll learn what it is like to be interviewed for the role and how people land these in demand jobs and walk away with practical tips on moving into the industry.

We're gearing up for our Data Science Immersive launch in Austin. Come hear what all the buzz is about and why the Harvard Business Review named data scientist the "sexiest job of the 21st century" and Glassdoor named it the "best job of the year" for 2016.
name: Crunching the Numbers: How to Launch a Career in Data

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot:https://generalassemb.ly/education/ilooklikeadeveloper/austin/28154

About This Event

According to a Department of Labor Current Population Survey, only 34% of all Web Developers are women. It is now 2016 and high time for those statistics to change. Developer positions earn on average $50,000-70,000 as an entry level Junior Developer and give women the work from home flexibility and work-life balance that not many other industries offer.

In an effort to get more women interested in coding and empowered to pursue the work they love General Assembly is partnering with several organizations to host a night of coding and fellowship. Come hear a quick panel of a few of our favorite female developers tell how they got in the industry, what the day to day looks like, which language to learn and then try your hand at writing your first line of code! Do you have what it takes?

We think you do!
name: #ILookLikeADeveloper

desc:
Please note this is a free event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/contextual-research-and-the-user-experience-applying-anthropology/austin/28424

About This Event

With the increasing focus on the digital marketplace, it’s never been more critical to learn from and understand your targeted customers. Understanding context is vital to understanding customer experience. This panel will cover the many ways to gather contextual insights, with real world examples of how to plan, implement and summarize research to deliver actionable results. Enter the world of UX, strategy, visual design or project management, where you can use your research skills to make a difference.

Join us for the Texas Anthropology Summit Kick Off here at General Assembly as we open the weekend with happy hour, networking and a panel highlighting the best of digital and industrial applications of anthropological research.
name: Contextual Research and the User Experience: Applying Anthropology

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/user-experience-design-bootcamp/austin/26994

About This Workshop

As technology changes and more companies compete for customers’ time, providing a useful and enjoyable experience is critical to both attracting and retaining customers. This class aims to demystify user experience by giving a practical and simple introduction to what UX is while explaining some of its core concepts. This is a field that affects all areas of business — prepare to dip your toes into an ocean of new concepts and ideas that will enlighten your perspective on the human-computer interaction experience.

Takeaways

Discover what the field of UX encompasses and how it relates to other disciplines
Learn about user-centered design principles and how you can incorporate them into the design process
Gain first-hand knowledge about various UX deliverables and how best to implement them
Sketch and build a low-fidelity prototype

Prereqs & Preparation

Bring your laptop & cell phone. Nothing else required!
name: User Experience Design Bootcamp

desc:

About This Workshop Series

This workshop will introduce students to data exploration and machine learning techniques. Students will learn about the data science workflow and will practice exploring and visualizing data using Python and associated data science packages. Students will also explore the differences between supervised and unsupervised learning techniques and practice creating predictive models.
. Takeaways

Set up your environment for data science in Python and learn about commonly used data science packages.
Use the Pandas Library to import, clean, analyze, and visualize data.
Implement, optimize, and evaluate supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques using Scikit-Learn

Prereqs & Preparation

A background in computer science, programming, science, engineering, and/or statistics is preferred for this workshop. It is not required but you are expected to be somewhat familiar with command line tools, basic statistics, and how to write simple programs.

Please bring a laptop with Python set up.
name: Intro to Data Science and Machine Learning Workshop

About This Class

Google Analytics is an incredibly robust, free tool for measuring web traffic data. In this class, you’ll get to know the basics of using Google Analytics to track and evaluate performance and draw insights to improve your business. Starting with basic terminology and key metrics, you’ll build a foundation of knowledge before diving deeper into more complex analytics techniques, including advertising tracking and custom segments. You’ll walk away with a fundamental understanding of Google Analytics’ role in running and operating your business.

Takeaways

Learn the basic setup, navigation, and interface of Google Analytics
Get acquainted with basic terminology and mathematical formulas to understand key metrics
Be able to identify the metrics that matter for your specific business case and how to use them to make educated decisions
Create custom segments, goals, URLs, and dashboards
Create automated alerts and scheduled reports
Learn to identify exceptions and surface actionable insights
Export data for further analysis in Excel
Design useful charts for sharing with colleagues or clients

Prereqs & Preparation

It would be useful to have a basic understanding of Excel, but we will cover it in class as well. Laptops are welcomed but not necessary.
name: Introduction to Google Analytics

desc:
Please note this is a free event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/building-a-culture-of-brand-advocates/austin/28153

About This Event

Your employees are one of the most valuable marketing assets available. Building a group of employee advocates may seem overwhelming, but is essential to your brand's image.

The key is to understand why employees would advocate for the company. What's in it for them? How do you make it feel natural for them to advocate? How can you motivate them to do it well? What opportunities exist in Austin?

In this session, we will explore the different motivators around brand advocacy and identify several ways that you can create this culture and equip your employees with the tools necessary to succeed.

We invite the community to discuss with our panel what has worked well. Topics include: having a strong mission, fostering a culture of learning and development, recruiting self-motivated individuals, leveraging social media, and promoting community involvement through mentoring and speaking opportunities.
name: Building A Culture Of Brand Advocates

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/careerproof-how-to-land-great-work/austin/29101

About This Class

We have all felt anxious or stuck during our career. Maybe you are bored or feel undervalued. You are ready for a change, but feel paralyzed by uncertainty. How do you connect your talents and passion to work that makes you come alive? We have good news, you don't have to struggle to figure out what comes next. The hard truth is that we are typically not taught how to create breakout career opportunities. The best jobs, the jobs you really want, are rarely advertised. Let me tell you, there is a great big world of exciting careers. Finding and landing these jobs is a skill you can learn. This fun, high-energy class will transform your career mindset to put you on a path to becoming careerproof; bold confidence to always find and land meaningful work.

Takeaways

Learn the framework to clarify what you want and how to get it
Reframe your perspective from employee to entrepreneur
Learn tactics to discover hidden jobs
How to amplify and leverage your social capital
Complete your assets-to-action plan to start immediately

Prereqs & Preparation

Come as you are and learn the strategy and tactics to overcome common obstacles, connect authentically with the right people, and land (or create) work perfectly suited to your unique interests and talents.

You can do it no matter your age and experience.
You can do it even if you feel anxious or overwhelmed.
You can do it even if you don't know where to start.
name: Careerproof: How to Land Great Work

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/design-your-first-ecommerce-website/austin/28043

About This Class

Wish you had a better understanding of the eCommerce ecosystem? Perhaps you are on the verge of setting up your online business? This workshop will guide early stage and new online merchants on how to design & implement an ecommerce site using online tools like Wordpress & WooCommerce.

The session will cover:
Why Wordpress & Woocommerce make a great team for selling online
Learn the basics of Wordpress and how to set up a standard website using Wordpress CMS
Brief overview of ecommerce best practices and standards
Installation of WooCommerce
Learn to set up products and other options
Payment gateway integration 

Additionally, the class will give students a detailed overview of the fundamental processes & best practices essential to successfully launching an online store.

Prereqs & Preparation

A laptop is required for this session. Please have a local or remote installation of Wordpress on your laptop. You can bring your own product images to work with or we will provide sample artwork for your use.
name: Design Your First eCommerce Website

About This Class

Considering striking out on your own into the growing field of freelancing? Then this is the workshop for you. In it you’ll learn:
Things to consider before taking the plunge
How to find the right clients and projects
The pros and cons of different pricing methods
Ways to develop strong time management and work habits
Pitfalls to avoid
Administrative stuff like incorporating, bank accounts, insurance, bookkeeping, etc.

Takeaways

After this workshop you’ll have the foundational knowledge required to become a freelancer. Most importantly you’ll know how to:
Find your strengths and market them
Discover profitable projects through referrals, research, and networking
Handle the day-to-day details
Strategies for growing

Prereqs & Preparation

Please bring a laptop and be prepared to discuss why you’re interested in becoming a freelancer and what your biggest concern is.
name: Freelancing 101: Becoming Your Own Boss

This workshop will cover the basic fundamentals of creating a successful blog: platforms, content strategy, creating quality and engaging content, the importance of good photographic and graphics, creating a call to action, content schedule and marketing your blog.

We also will cover ways to monetize a blog including: Partnerships, Advertising & Content Marketing.
At the tail end of this workshop we will breakout into teams and challenge you to create a blog, write one short post and put together a strategy. We will work with the teams to make suggestions, answer questions and help you strategize.

How to monetize a blog

About This Class

There are over 1 billion people checking Facebook daily and if you are not currently advertising, you’re missing out on the ability to reach the ones that will love your product or service. This class will teach you some of the insider secrets about the new Facebook ad platform and how to target your ads to be shown to the people most interested in your business.

Topics covered will include creating ads, targeting ads, setting up custom audiences, retargeting, the power editor and best practices for getting the best return on your ad spend. Q&A session will be included at the end so participants can ask any questions related to their business.

General Assembly and Wayblazer have partnered up to challenge you to create the ultimate travel experience. Join us as we officially kick off Start Up Week with what it's all about- technical innovation.

The three top teams will be chosen on Sunday evening for final judging. Those teams will have the opportunity to present their apps to the entire startup community at a party and judging of the finalist's projects as the Tuesday evening Start Up Week event. Winners have a chance at major prizes including $500 hotel credit per team member, GA classes, and more! Schedule

Saturday, 1 October 10 am – 10 pm CDT

Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner provided. We'll kick off at 10:00 AM with team check-in and the prompt and let you go!


Sunday, 2 October 10 am – 8 pm CDT
Hackathon Day 2
We'll provide breakfast lunch and dinner. Teams will finish up their apps and we'll start the presentations by 6:00 PM! The three finalist teams will be chosen to move on to the final judging party on Tuesday!

Please note this is a free event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/ux-design-101/austin/29183

About This Class

As people and technology continue to evolve, providing a positive user experience becomes even more critical to achieving organizational goals. But what does the term user experience really mean?

User Experience is exciting and affects many verticals, jobs, and businesses. In this 101 level class we will explore this buzz-worthy concept and break it down into meaningful, actionable bits. We will also get to practice user interviewing, a key part of the UX process.

This is an ideal 101 class for someone who has heard the term UX and maybe even understands the basics, but is not sure what it really means to them. Developers, Business People, and Designers may especially benefit from this survey of a rapidly developing field.

Takeaways

Define User Experience and how it impacts business customers.
Identify how to understand users through interviewing.
Interview classmates using UX interview tactics.
Explain specialities within the User Experience field, and how to take the next steps for further learning.

Prereqs & Preparation

Watch this introduction to UX video
name: UX Design 101

Please note this is a free event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/coding-101-htmlcss/austin/29182

About This Class

HTML and CSS are the fundamental building blocks of the web. Whether you're a beginner who wants to get started in web development, a designer looking to hand-code their concepts, or a marketer who wants a little more control over their CMS, you'll need to know HTML and CSS to get the job done!

In this hands-on introductory workshop, we’ll learn about the web development community and how the web works. We’ll go over key coding terminology and principles, introduce languages like HTML and CSS, discuss what their functions are and how they work together, then use that new knowledge to write our own code and develop a simple site.

Students should be familiar with the basic functions of their computer, such as launching programs, creating folders, copying and pasting objects, formatting text, finding and saving files.

Takeaways

Gain an overview of the web development landscape and where HTML/CSS fits in the web ecosystem.
Describe the difference between front-end and back-end code and the basic components of HTML, CSS, and Javascript
Use HTML and CSS to mark up a basic webpage.
Describe the different jobs that use coding or benefit from an understanding of HTML/CSS.

Prereqs & Preparation

A laptop is required for this workshop. For those on Windows, you’ll need Microsoft Windows 7/8/10 (32- or 64-bit). For those with Macs, you’ll need the Mac OS X[masked] or higher, up to[masked] (El Capitan). Upgrade your operating system before class, if needed. Basic technical aptitude and orientation to computers, and curiosity to learn new tools. Download Sublime Text 3
name: Coding 101: HTML/CSS

Data drives decisions; are you part of the conversation around data? Regardless of your industry or role, fluency in the language of data analytics will allow you to contribute to data driven decision making. The digital landscape is moving at a lightning fast pace. Every industry has been affected by advances in the digital field, from retailers to brands and agencies.

In this introductory class, develop an understanding of the digital marketing landscape and the identify the key components and metrics behind a digital marketing strategy.

Product Management is an increasingly in-demand career. This workshop focuses on a core skill of product management: how to identify and understand problems. You’ll walk through the first stage of the product development process, and discuss the concept of the Minimum Viable Product, or MVP, as a foundation for solving the problems we’ve uncovered.

This session doesn’t require a laptop, but come prepared to problem-solve, discuss and sketch!

Describe the Product Management job landscape and learning opportunities for product management skills.

About This Class

We live in a world with overwhelming amounts of data. In this workshop you'll learn how to get the most out of this data using Tableau's specialized Visual Analytics software.

In this class, we will dive deeper into chart types learned in the intro class, understanding how to customize them to meet their needs. We will also discuss chart selection and understanding which type of business problem should use which type of chart.

Learn to understand data setup/cleaning in order to prepare data for analysis and build interactive dashboards that answer a variety of business problems.

Takeaways

Conduct a “cradle to grave” analysis including: finding data, cleaning it, analyzing it, and presenting it via dashboards
Understand what types of charts / dashboards should be use given a specific business problem
Ability to discuss which tools are best for which types of analysis (excel, Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server, etc.)
Understand how Tableau fits within the larger enterprise setup for analytics, and how they can use it to further their own careers and analyses tomorrow

Prereqs & Preparation

Please bring a laptop with Microsoft Excel, as well as Tableau Public installed (public.tableau.com)

It's not required, but we suggest you take the Intro class prior to this class: http://ga.co/1Qa0lea

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/intro-to-sketchnoting-fundamentals-of-visual-notetaking/austin/29676

About This Workshop

We were all taught how to take notes, but unfortunately, nearly everything we were taught is wrong. After all, how often do you re-read the notes you take? And when you do, how vividly do they bring the original event back into your mind? Chances are, those handwritten or typed notes aren’t making much traction after the fact. But there is a better way.

Visual note-taking, or Sketchnoting, is a method of listening and recording information using both words and pictures. It helps with information retention, improves your brain’s ability to stay engaged during the event, and it’s fun. Best of all, anyone can do it. This hands-on workshop will prove it to you, introducing you to the fundamentals of sketchnoting and providing practice in both listening and drawing. Participants will leave armed with the knowledge and tools to think, capture, and communicate in big picture ways.

Takeaways

An understanding of the benefits of visual note-taking (or Sketchnoting) for both listening and communicating
An introduction to the Sketchnoting process and the basic anatomy of a Sketchnote
Hands-on experience building your own visual vocabulary
Tools and techniques to strengthen your visual practice
Personal confidence in your ability to listen and draw your (and others’) ideas

Prereqs & Preparation

Students must bring a pen and an unlined notebook.
name: Intro to Sketchnoting: Fundamentals of Visual Notetaking

Please note this is a paid class. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/excel-at-excel-getting-down-the-basics/austin/29099

About This Class

We’ve all heard of Microsoft Excel, and yet a surprising number of people have little to no experience using it. In this class — ideal for people working in business, management, or simply interested in getting more organized — you’ll learn the basics of the application, including calculation, formatting, and charts. There will also be an introduction to some intermediate functions such as VLookup and If-Then. A basic understanding of Excel goes a very long way when it comes to managing your job or business. This class will make you more desirable job candidate and more productive as a worker.

Takeaways

Input, gather, massage, and format data for more productive use and sharing.
Analyze data to improve decision making.
Output and package data for external consumption.

Prereqs & Preparation

Students should have a general familiarity with Excel, including knowing how to navigate a spreadsheet, and how to copy & paste. Please bring a laptop with Microsoft Office 7 or 10 installed (PC recommended, Mac acceptable. Most functions/features should work on a Mac although there may be minor differences. The instructor will be using a PC. It is also highly recommended that you bring a mouse. This is an interactive class, and your participation and questions are encouraged.
name: Excel at Excel: Getting Down the Basics

- Things to consider before taking the plunge
- How to find the right clients and projects
- The pros and cons of different pricing methods
- Ways to develop strong time management and work habits
- Pitfalls to avoid
- Administrative stuff like incorporating, bank accounts, insurance, bookkeeping, etc.

Takeaways

After this workshop you’ll have the foundational knowledge required to become a freelancer. Most importantly you’ll know how to:
- Find your strengths and market them
- Discover profitable projects through referrals, research, and networking
- Handle the day-to-day details
- Strategies for growing

Prereqs & Preparation

Please bring a laptop and be prepared to discuss why you’re interested in becoming a freelancer and what your biggest concern is.
name: Freelancing 101: Becoming Your Own Boss

About This Class

In this class we will move beyond the basics of spreadsheet creation. Topics will include data manipulation/troubleshooting and advanced functions to summarize and analyze data having multiple attributes. We will also introduce Pivot Tables, advanced graphs, and macros. Class exercises will be utilized to facilitate understanding.

Takeaways

Students will learn how to effectively streamline and analyze data using some of the more advanced features of Excel.

Prereqs & Preparation

A basic understanding of the Excel spreadsheet layout and Pivot Tables
Common uses such as entering data into a blank spreadsheet and copying/pasting
An understanding of common functions such as SUM, IF, and VLOOKUP
Ability to create a graph from two or more sets of data points

Instructions for setting up the Developer tab for Macros:
PC: File > Options > Customize Ribbon > check "Developer"
Mac: Excel > Preferences > View > in Ribbon > check "Developer tab"
name: Advanced Excel: Beyond the Basics

Please note this is a free event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/craft-your-brand/austin/30189

About This Event

You aren't just your resume or LinkedIn profile. You are your BRAND.

Your personal brand is the story you tell the world through your words, actions, ideas, and opinions. If you don't create that brand yourself, the world will create one for you. Whether you're just starting your career, changing jobs, or simply looking for ways to up-level your profile in your current industry, having a clear personal brand is critical for getting what you want from life. Join us at Hops + Grain Brewery where we'll teach you how to craft your brand over craft beers- because learning is better with beer!

At Craft Your Brand, Deb Gabor, CEO of Sol Marketing and author of the bestselling book Branding is Sex: Get Your Customer Laid and Sell the Hell Out of Anything, leads a hands-on workshop during which you will learn how to create and take ownership of your own personal brand.


Takeaways

Learn the basics of branding and how they apply to developing and telling your personal brand story
Identify your purpose and passion and your "WHY"
Create the strategic foundation for your own personal brand
Get exposed to some important personal branding "hacks" that unlock your personal brand potential
Practice telling your brand story through the "Anti-Elevator Pitch" process
name: Craft Your Brand

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/project-management-101/austin/29404

About This Class

The profession of project management, specifically digital and web project management, has recently become one of the hottest jobs in the tech market.

Many growing Austin organizations have come to recognize the need for project managers in the wake of expanding operations and project teams. It’s not uncommon for designers and developers to find themselves cast in the role of project manager, even if many of these responsibilities fall well outside their job description. This is also a good time to “break into” the profession of project management for folks who work in a capacity related to design or development.

Our course will focus specifically on the basics of project management for beginners; whether you’ve recently found yourself cast in the role of project manager by your company, or whether you’re looking to make a career transition.

We will cover everything from project planning, project management methodologies (Agile and Waterfall), running meetings, and the “soft skills” needed to successfully facilitate a project. We’ll also explore the major project management tools in the marketplace.

Takeaways

Creating a project plan (requirements, scope, budget, resource allocation, timeline, risk factors) Kicking off a project with clients, stakeholders, and your team by getting buy-off on timeline and scope. Facilitating the project (meeting deadlines, recognizing risk, prioritizing needs, mitigating conflicts, adjusting timelines Honing the soft skills needed to navigate successful interpersonal relationships with clients and team members.
name: Project Management 101

About This Event

If you can’t make it to this year’s Lean Startup Week in San Francisco, don’t miss out on hearing from the entrepreneurs and thought leaders powering today’s innovation. As their official live stream partner, General Assembly brings the action to your local campus with a community viewing event.

Watch the keynote speakers live with your fellow startup community over food, drinks, and stimulating conversation. Plus, participate from your city by submitting Q&A questions for the panel via the same online form that conference attendees use.

Join us on Wednesday, November 2nd to hear from industry thought leaders, including: Entrepreneur and author of The Lean Startup, Eric Ries;
Venture capitalist and author, Guy Kawasaki;
Breather CCO and co-founder, Caterina Rizzi;
General Assembly co-founder, Matthew Brimer;
And many more.

Please note that by RSVPing for this event you are agreeing to receive communications from Lean Startup Week​
name: GA Presents: Lean Startup Week

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/user-experience-journey-mapping/austin/30373

About This Class

You are not your user. It’s one of the most critical understandings of a User Experience designer. And knowing that to be true, it becomes even more critical for designers to build empathy for and relate to the users they are designing for.

This class will help students learn to create and understand personas, and use that as the groundwork to understand and solve for our user. Along the way we will construct an empathy map and use that data as the basis for building a journey map and identifying opportunities.

By the end of class students will have the information needed to design and implement UX tools such as empathy maps, personas and journey maps so that they can go back and better understand and empathize with their users.


Takeaways

Students of this workshop will learn:
Where and how to find the necessary data and research inputs to customer journey maps
How to build an empathy map based on a persona
How to create a journey map and identify opportunities uncovered by it.
name: User Experience: Journey Mapping

desc:
Celebrate Austin design through a week of workshops, talks, studio tours and events this November as the city celebrates its creative economy in the inaugural Austin Design Week. We’ve invited the community to propose and showcase the best in visual, interactive, product, industrial, architectural and civic design. The introduction of Design Week provides the opportunity to bring together the Austin design community like never before. From the spaces we’re inspired by, to the images that leap from the page, the products we use daily and the way we interact with them, Austin is pushing the boundaries of design. Explore the cutting edge work being done through some of the city’s most innovative creators.

Austin Design Week runs from November 7th - 11th in various locations around the city. Check out the schedule + RSVP here: http://designweekaustin.com/schedule

Day 1 Schedule:
10am - 6pm Austin Design Week Hub (@DFA Building @ UT Austin)

12PM - 1:30PM - WORKSHOPS
Apparel Screen Printing @ Industry Print Shop
From Tangible to Intuitive: The Abstraction of Products & Design @ General Assembly

3PM - 5PM - STUDIO TOURS
Handsome Studio Tour
McKinney York Architects Studio Tour
Fjord Studio Tour
Fisterra Projects Studio Tour

6PM - 9PM - EVENING EVENT
ADW Kickoff: Welcome Keynote and Craft Beer by Design @ Austin Beerworks

Check out the calendar for the rest of the week
name: Austin Design Week

desc:
Please note this is a free event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/teach-at-ga-atx-training-on-instructional-best-practices/austin/29673

About This Workshop

Specifically created for current and future GA instructors, this workshop will equip you with tips and strategies to set you up for success even before you step into the classroom. You'll learn instructional best practices for lesson planning and prep as well as the basics on how to to check for understanding, increase student engagement in class, and start to build your instructor toolkit. You'll walk away with valuable insight on how to approach your next teaching opportunity.


Takeaways

Describe at least 3 key takeaways about Adult Learning Theory and how they apply to lesson planning
Create an opening hook to frame your lessons and set appropriate expectations by asking 3 questions
Identify and describe at least 3 techniques to check for understanding
Recall the 5 step method framework to classroom management


Prereqs & Preparation

Currently an instructor with GA or interested in teaching opportunities at GA.
Please bring a laptop - or at the very least, a notepad and pen/pencil.
Please have a topic in mind that you'd like to teach, or are currently teaching - if you have an existing lesson plan that you'd like to annotate or update, even better.
name: Teach at GA ATX: Training on Instructional Best Practices

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/intro-to-python/austin/30805


About This Workshop

Python is a versatile and widely-used programming language with many applications. This workshop explores Python's place in the scientific ecosystem, and how the language, with several readily-available open-source libraries, can serve as a powerful tool for data analysis. Designed as a stand-alone introduction to the data science aspects of Python, this class is also a recommended refresher for students planning to enroll in General Assembly's upcoming Data Science course. The course is hands-on and exercise based, so students will get plenty of practice.


Takeaways

Ability to write and run Python scripts
Ability to use Python for basic data analysis tasks (data cleaning and reformatting, exploration, analysis)
Understanding of Python’s role as a tool in the backend and analysis toolkits
Understanding of the possibilities opened up through a better understanding of Python


Prereqs & Preparation

General technical savvy, and comfort with computers
Some prior experience with use of computers for analysis or repetitive tasks – such as Excel
Installation of Anaconda for Python 2.7, which is a free distribution of python that includes libraries of open source python tools (http://continuum.io/downloads).
name: Intro to Python

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/social-media-strategy-mapping/austin/30802


About This Workshop

Social media initiatives don’t start when you register a Facebook or Twitter account and start posting announcements, it begins much sooner. In this workshop, you’ll be taken through a 6-step methodology that will help guide your efforts to develop an actionable social media strategy. You’ll learn how to structure your social media efforts, deploy your resources, and ultimately launch a social media campaign that is professional and provides results you’ll be able to interpret and understand.


Takeaways

Learn how to develop and implement a social media strategy.
Create an elevator pitch that clearly defines your brand, audience, and key differentiator.
Define and track the KPIs most relevant to your business.
Describe the different between major social media platforms.
Identify which platforms to use for your business.
Explain the difference between publishing, listening, and reporting tools.
Create a weekly content calendar for your business.


Prereqs & Preparation

None! Please bring a laptop to class, along with a notepad and pen.
name: Social Media Strategy Mapping

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/user-experience-design-bootcamp/austin/30363

About This Workshop

As technology changes and more companies compete for customers’ time, providing a useful and enjoyable experience is critical to both attracting and retaining customers. This class aims to demystify user experience by giving a practical and simple introduction to what UX is while explaining some of its core concepts. This is a field that affects all areas of business — prepare to dip your toes into an ocean of new concepts and ideas that will enlighten your perspective on the human-computer interaction experience.

Takeaways

- Discover what the field of UX encompasses and how it relates to other disciplines.
- Learn about user-centered design principles and how you can incorporate them into the design process.
- Gain first-hand knowledge about various UX deliverables and how best to implement them.
- Sketch and build a low-fidelity prototype

Prereqs & Preparation

Bring your laptop & cell phone. Nothing else required!
name: User Experience Design Bootcamp

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/getting-started-with-wordpress/austin/30867


About This Class

WordPress is the premier content management system for those seeking an easy, user-friendly way to set up and maintain a website. In this class, you’ll walk through the basics of getting your site live quickly and discover various free templates as well as premium resources that require little to no coding skills and will have your site looking polished and professional. Once your site has gone live, you’ll learn how to update and maintain it using the WordPress dashboard, as well as common problems and pitfalls to avoid. Plus you’ll find out how to customize your site to get the exact look you’re going for.


Takeaways

Learn the differences between WordPress.com and WordPress.org (self-hosted site)
Create and update content (pages, blog entries, photos etc) in WordPress quickly and efficiently
Discover different themes, what they are, where to get them, and how to customize them
Master plugins, widgets and settings


Prereqs & Preparation

This is a beginner to intermediate course which is designed to be helpful to those who have never seen WordPress before or those who have been using WordPress but without a formal understanding of the mechanics behind it. Some basic knowledge of navigating websites is the only requirement. Bring a paper and pen or a laptop to take good notes. Bring good questions. This class is a broad overview with time for answers on each topic.
name: Getting Started with Wordpress

About This Event

We’re mixing things up a bit this month! This meeting is a chance for General Assembly Product Management alumni to meet, have some drinks, and network with others in the Austin product management community. Whether you’ve taken classes at General Assembly or not, we encourage you to come out and meet with fellow product professionals. But wait!
There’s more…

The meeting will also feature lightning talks on our favorite Product Management tools and apps. Learn which products and software make our jobs easier and that we simply can’t live without. We’ll be discussing Trello, Xtensio, Zapier, Bullet Journal, and other great tools for Product Managers.

Speakers include: Mitch Heard, Aubrey Maker, Dan Corbin
name: Lightning Talks: Product Management Tools

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/introduction-to-google-analytics/austin/30803


About This Class

Google Analytics is an incredibly robust, free tool for measuring web traffic data. In this class, you’ll get to know the basics of using Google Analytics to track and evaluate performance and draw insights to improve your business. Starting with basic terminology and key metrics, you’ll build a foundation of knowledge before diving deeper into more complex analytics techniques, including advertising tracking and custom segments. You’ll walk away with a fundamental understanding of Google Analytics’ role in running and operating your business.


Takeaways

Learn the basic setup, navigation, and interface of Google Analytics
Get acquainted with basic terminology and mathematical formulas to understand key metrics
Be able to identify the metrics that matter for your specific business case and how to use them to make educated decisions
Create custom segments, goals, URLs, and dashboards
Create automated alerts and scheduled reports
Learn to identify exceptions and surface actionable insights
Export data for further analysis in Excel
Design useful charts for sharing with colleagues or clients


Prereqs & Preparation

It would be useful to have a basic understanding of Excel, but we will cover it in class as well. Laptops are welcomed but not necessary.
name: Introduction to Google Analytics

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/introduction-to-javascript/austin/30806


About This Class

Join us for this workshop on the JavaScript programming language aimed at beginners with little or no prior experience. This workshop provides an introduction to the JavaScript programming language and jQuery fundamentals needed to create rich, professional, and relevant web applications. Attendees will receive a hands-on approach in learning JavaScript's relationship to HTML and CSS.


Takeaways

Understand the role of the web browser and where JavaScript fits in
Define the role of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript in web pages and web applications
Define the DOM and JavaScript's importance in using it to create rich web applications
Understand and apply programming fundamentals using JavaScript: basic data types, arithmetic, conditional statements, iteration (loops), functions, arrays and objects


Prereqs & Preparation

Basic HTML experience may be helpful, but is not necessary.
Please bring a laptop to class.
Machine fluency and ability to install and run a program based on instructions.
name: Introduction to JavaScript

desc:
Please note this is a paid event. Follow the link to reserve your spot: https://generalassemb.ly/education/intro-to-data-science-and-machine-learning-workshop/austin/29789

About This Workshop

This workshop will introduce students to data exploration and machine learning techniques. Students will learn about the data science workflow and will practice exploring and visualizing data using R and built in libraries. Students will also explore the differences between supervised and unsupervised learning techniques and practice creating predictive regression models.

A background in computer science, programming, and/or statistics is preferred for this workshop. It is not required but you are expected to be somewhat familiar with the command line tools and how to write simple programs.

Takeaways

PART I: Data Exploration
-Understand course contents and structure
-Describe the data mining workflow and the key traits of a successful data scientist.
-Extract, format, and preprocess data using UNIX command-line tools.
-Explore and visualize data using R and ggplot2.

PART II: Intro to Machine Learning
-Explain the concepts and applications of supervised & unsupervised learning techniques.
-Describe categorical and continuous feature spaces, including examples and techniques for each.
-Discuss the purpose of machine learning and the interpretation of predictive modeling results.

Prereqs & Preparation

See pre-work document: https://www.dropbox.com/s/2t2gex4e0wxsft3/DAT%20PreWork.pdf
name: Intro to Data Science and Machine Learning Workshop

About This Event

Welcome to the UX of Yoga. We will start by discussing the basic concepts of User Design and the Design Process and then apply these principles to the development of a Yoga class. We will experiment with basic designs, and applying simple Agile iteration. Students will discuss experiences, observe understandings, and discuss positive criticism. Finally, we'll apply learned principles to the creation of a Yoga class that you'll then take with the awesome folks at Black Swan Yoga.


Takeaways

Understand the basic components of design methodology, and how it can be applied to all aspects of life, including yoga
Learn the benefits of intelligent process design
Practice and gather benefits of critcism and creation within a group dynamic
Learn the basics of Agile design
Understand effect and reason for UX Design


Prereqs & Preparation

Basic Yoga principles and an interest in User Experience Design.
****Please bring comfy clothes and a Yoga mat if you have one!
name: Yoga and UX

desc:
Happy 2016!

We'll be starting off with our usual Bleeding Edge Web segment. 

Corey will follow up with a short introduction to web components. Learn what web components are, the current state of web components, browser support, and discover what the shadow DOM actually is! This will be a shorter presentation, so Q&A is encouraged.


Pete Carapetyan, who comes primarily from a backend development background, will also give us an overview of his experience developing with Google Polymer. 

We're also looking for speakers to do short lightning talks about something they find interesting. 

As of right now we have:

• NGN (A Node+Docker microservices platform) - Corey

• Chassis (An event-bus UI "unframework") - Corey

• JavaScript Job Market in 2016 - Ankit Patel (MakerSquare)

• CSS Modules - Alden Daniels (Abilitie)


• Web Components with Vue.js - Ted Patrick


Please don't make Corey do all the talking :-) Send us a note if you would like to contribute a lightning talk. Remember, it can be a project you're working on, something you find interesting, a simple tip, or even a micro discussion around something.

As usual, the event will be live-streamed and our Slack group will be active during the meeting (request an invite). You only need to RSVP here if you plan to physically attend the meetup.

Our Sponsor: Atlas Wearables

Atlas Wearables will generously be providing pizza for the evening, and they are currently hiring!

Parking

Just a reminder that street parking is free after 6pm on Wed, but can sometimes be hard to find near the hotel. You can also park in the Omni garage, directly under Capital Factory (enter from Brazos) for a flat fee of $5. Don't forget to ask for a parking validation card before you leave!

desc:
Brian was lucky enough to score a ticket to React.js Conf this year in SF, and it happens to be the Mon-Tues before our meetup. If you're interested in React but can't make it to the conference in person, join us 24 hours after the conference ends for a fresh recap of the most interesting bits! As the organizers say "At React.js Conference 2015, we announced React Native, GraphQL, and Relay" so odds are good that it won't disappoint. (NOTE: we are in the small classroom this month, so seating will be more limited than normal!)

If anyone else is attending the conference, please let me know so we can coordinate!

News From the Bleeding Edge

Lightning Talks

• NGN (A Node+Docker microservices platform) - Corey

desc:
A Go Imaging Server

Go is an open source programming language developed by Google. It was designed for performance (built on concurrency) and developer ergonomics. While relatively new, it has been rapidly gaining in popularity and is being adopted by startups and large enterprises. It was also used to develop systems such as Docker and Kubernetes.

Jud White will give us an overview of the Go language, related tooling, its library ecosystem and an in-depth look at the language's concurrency features. He'll also give a live demo of Go that showcases its concurrent features.

Jud works on backend systems at Dell powering the e-Commerce side of dell.com with a focus on performance and usability. You can follow him at @judson_white or on Github at https://github.com/judwhite.

News From the Bleeding Edge

In addition to the Go talk, Brian will start us off with the crowd favorite "News from the Bleeding Edge" segment, in which we'll discuss all the latest and greatest in browsers and web app development.

Lightning Talks

• My Experience Building nvm-windows in Go - Corey Butler

• Building a Go Imaging Server - Ted Patrick


If you have a cool side project or are using an awesome new framework, come tell us about it! Quick talks or demos of 10 minutes or less are perfect. If you're interested contact one of us and we'll add you to the list.

VestU.com provides clear, unbiased investment education and funded portfolios to empower individual investors. Founder Ted Patrick will be on hand to tell us about the service and set attendees up with free accounts!

desc:
In this talk we will discuss microservices.  We will try to persuade you to think hard before going down the distributed system approach to building applications. And then we will discuss the many aspects that are required to build distributed systems that are easier to manage and maintain. We will take a look at the benefits of microservices as we discuss how to run them in a production application.  As this is a panel discussion we welcome real time questions along the way.  This is a technology-agnostic discussion.  We do mention some tools that handle various concepts, but we don't favor any one tool.  Also, this is not a cloud only or specific vendor discussion.

About the Panelists

James Allen
Cloud Engineer @ Volusion
in/jamesallenatx

Miguel Gonzalez
Chief Architect @ The Boon Group
in/magonz | @doesnotcompile

Gabriel Schenker
Distinguished Architect @ Clear Measure
in/gabrielschenker | @gnschenker

Seth Orell
Director of Engineering @ Volusion
in/sethorell

Andrew Siemer
Director of Engineering @ Volusion
in/andrewsiemer | @asiemer

Campbell McNeill
CTO @ Cocolevio
@campbellmcneill


News From the Bleeding Edge

In addition to the Microservices talk, Brian will start us off with the crowd favorite "News from the Bleeding Edge" segment, in which we'll discuss all the latest and greatest in browsers and web app development.

Lightning Talks

• How We Run Microservices on Iron.io - Brian Moeskau (@bmoeskau)

• Build and Share a Visually Stunning Web App in 5 Minutes with the Sonar Platform - Adrian Penn (@adrianpenn)


If you have a cool side project or are using an awesome new framework, come tell us about it! Quick talks or demos of 5-10 minutes are perfect. If you're interested contact one of us and we'll add you to the list.

desc:
Node 6 just arrived and is a huge upgrade for Node developers. Wondering what all the fuss is about? Still on Node 4 like me, or... maybe 0.10?! Then you'll definitely want to come learn what you have to look forward to!

Evan Lucas will tell us all about what's new and exciting with Node 6 including:

• New platform features you should know about


• Upgraded V8 and what that means for your code (hint: ES2015!)


• Issues / gotchas you may want to know about before upgrading


• Node versioning (Current vs LTS and how to choose)


• How you can contribute!


About the Speaker

Evan works at Help.com on the Node side of things with a focus on performance. He is a member of the Node.js Core Technical Committee (CTC) and helps coordinate Node releases. You can follow him at @evanhlucas or on Github.

desc:
Vue.js is a library for building interactive web interfaces. The goal of Vue.js is to provide the benefits of reactive data binding and composable view components with an API that is as simple as possible.

Vue.js itself is not a full-blown framework -- it is focused on the view layer only. It is therefore very easy to pick up and to integrate with other libraries or existing projects. On the other hand, when used in combination with proper tooling and supporting libraries, Vue.js is also perfectly capable of powering sophisticated Single-Page Applications.

Ted Patrick and the team at light.ly have been using Vue.js to build applications for the print and banking industries. This talk will explore Vue basics, creating components, and building larger scale applications with the library.

About the Speaker

Ted Patrick has been building applications for 30 years. His experience spans work at Adobe Systems, Barnes & Noble NOOK, Sencha Inc. and several startups including VestU.com. You can follow Ted @__ted__.

News From the Bleeding Edge

In addition to the Vue.js talk, Corey will start us off with the crowd favorite "News from the Bleeding Edge" segment, in which we'll discuss all the latest and greatest in browsers and web app development.

Lightning Talks

This talk will provide a brief overview of ClojureScript, some of the awesome powers it provides, and then a detailed overview of server-side rendering of React.js in pure Clojure, without Selenium or Node.js. Main topics covered will be:

desc:
Join Sauce Labs’ Automation Specialist and Selenium project contributor, Leo Laskin, as he discusses the value of open source in testing. He will also share his personal experience in moving from manual to automated testing, the lessons he has learned, and the steps he took to build a powerful, automated test coding army.

About the Speaker

As Sauce Labs’ Automation Advisor, Leo Laskin has over 10 years of experience in Quality Assurance. Starting with manual testing and moving into automation and leadership, he has seen many of the ups and down of testing. At Sauce Labs, Leo is responsible for providing in-depth technical advice to customers about how to be successful with their automation and CI/CD efforts. In prior roles, he held QA engineering and leadership positions to help automation efforts. He’s also a contributor and supporter of Selenium since 2010, the most popular QA automation tool in use today for testing of both web-based applications as well as mobile devices. He holds a BS in CS from the University of Massachusetts.

News From the Bleeding Edge

In addition to the main talk, Brian will start us off with the crowd favorite "News from the Bleeding Edge" segment, in which we'll discuss all the latest and greatest in browsers and web app development.

Lightning Talks

• Top 10 Web Dev Tricks with VSCode (Ted Patrick)

If you have a cool side project or are using an awesome new framework, come tell us about it! Quick 5 minute talks or demos are perfect. If you're interested sign up here.

Sponsor: Sauce Labs

Our thanks to Sauce Labs this month for sponsoring food and drink (plus giveaways for attendees). Sauce Labs provides the world’s largest cloud-based platform for the automated testing of web and mobile applications. Optimized for Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD), Sauce eliminates the time and expense of maintaining an in-house testing infrastructure, freeing development teams of any size to innovate and release better software, faster.


Can't Make it in Person?

Our events are livestreamed -- watch here (available once the meetup begins). You can also jump into Slack for virtual Q&A and discussion during the meeting -- look for the #live-meetup channel. Drop us a line to be added to the group ([masked]).

NOTE: Please RSVP here ONLY if you plan to attend in person as it helps us plan for attendance and food. If you plan to watch online there's no need to RSVP.

Parking

Street parking is free after 6pm on Wednesdays. You can also park in the Omni garage, directly under Capital Factory (enter from Brazos) for a flat fee of $5. Don't forget to ask for a parking validation card before you leave!

desc:
Docker may well be the most important tool in the toolbox as development teams evolve their methods to address new challenges and opportunities including the call for evolution to a DevOps model.

Aater Suleman, CEO of Flux7, is  a recognized expert in Docker and helping organizations adopt modern technology including cloud, CI/CD and containers. Join us to learn how to get started and to evolve Docker skills as a strategic enabler for organizations seeking to streamline workflow and reduce the need for hardware investment. Aater will share:

• How Docker is evolving from its initial entry into the market as a lightweight, portable “build once, configure once and run anywhere” container

• Practical advice for using Docker to optimize developer workflows (code delivery), saving time coding and improving the quality and speed of software releases

• The evolution of Docker as a key component of a microservices strategy

About the Speaker

Aater Suleman, Ph.D. is the CEO & Co-Founder at Flux7, a Docker Authorized consulting partner and one of only eight original Docker foundation partners. The award-winning company is an AWS Advanced tier partner recognized for its DevOps proficiency. Flux7 DevOps projects have been featured at Dockercon and at AWS re:Invent each year since the company’s inception in 2013. Mr. Suleman earned his PhD at the University of Texas at Austin, where he teaches computer systems design and architecture. Contact Aater on LinkedIn, at www.Flux7.com or at @futurechips.

News From the Bleeding Edge

In addition to the main talk, Brian will start us off with the crowd favorite "News from the Bleeding Edge" segment, in which we'll discuss all the latest and greatest in browsers and web app development.

Lightning Talks

"Hey there Meteor, What's New?"

Meteor has been changing a lot recently and adding a bunch of new, interesting stuff. Michael Cole (@MichaelMakeCode) will fill us in on the details.

"Make it Blink!"

Ted Patrick (@__ted__) will share a quick demo of Arduino from a web dev perspective.

Sponsor: XO Group


Our thanks to XO Group this month for sponsoring food and drink! Through their family of brands—The Knot, The Nest and The Bump—they inspire, inform and cheer on their community as they move through life’s most amazing (and stressful!) milestones. XO Group is actively expanding their Austin office, hiring for several positions including developers, product designers, QA and more.


Can't Make it in Person?

Our events are livestreamed -- watch here (available once the meetup begins). You can also jump into Slack for virtual Q&A and discussion during the meeting -- look for the #live-meetup channel. Please join the group if you haven't already!

NOTE: Please RSVP here ONLY if you plan to attend in person as it helps us plan for attendance and food. If you plan to watch online there's no need to RSVP.

Parking

Street parking is free after 6pm on Wednesdays. You can also park in the Omni garage, directly under Capital Factory (enter from Brazos) for a flat fee of $5. Don't forget to ask for a parking validation card before you leave!
name: Docker as a Strategic Enabler for Dev Teams

desc:
React and Redux have made a huge impact on front end web development -- they are amazing tools, but the pace of change is very fast and best practices are hard to keep up with. Ryan Vice is here to share some practical advice based on the real-world experience he and his team have gained over multiple projects and while developing their own custom React boilerplate focused on developer ergonomics. Avoid months of trial and error and hit the ground running with:

• Auth strategy


• Forms and validation


• Testing and debugging


• Redux patterns and file organization


• Good lean devops practices


• Async, routing, error handling and more


About the Speaker

Ryan Vice is the founder and Chief Architect of Vice Software, and author of Mastering React. Ryan has been awarded Microsoft's MVP award three times and is a frequent speaker at meetups and conferences. Vice Software specializes in tailoring solutions that maximize business value for their clients whether they are looking to get their MVP to market quickly and on a budget or whether they are looking to modernize their existing applications. If you need help with your next React project contact Ryan today!

News From the Bleeding Edge

In addition to the main talk, Corey will start us off with the crowd favorite "News from the Bleeding Edge" segment, in which we'll discuss all the latest and greatest in browsers and web app development.

Sponsor: PayPal

PayPal is at the forefront of creating large scale Node.js applications and building open source technologies such as Kraken.js. If you are interested in building high performance, high availability and highly interactive websites, PayPal may be the place for you. We are always looking for great talent and people with a passion for delivering superior user experiences.

Can't Make it in Person?

Our events are livestreamed -- watch here (available once the meetup begins). You can also jump into Slack for virtual Q&A and discussion during the meeting -- look for the #live-meetup channel. Please join the group if you haven't already!

desc:
To attend, please register on Eventbrite at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-lean-product-playbook-by-dan-olsen-tickets-19839869584

Signing at up here on Meetup page alone is not sufficient! Thank you.

Product Austin is excited to have Dan Olsen share the key ideas from his new bestselling book The Lean Product Playbook. Most of us are familiar with Lean Startup and its valuable concepts, such as product-market fit and the build-measure-learn loop. However, many product teams run into challenges when they try to adopt Lean Startup principles because they lack specific guidance on what to do and how to do it. The Lean Product Playbook provides specific, step-by-step guidance on how to apply Lean Startup ideas. In his talk, Dan will describe an actionable model for product-market fit and a 6-step process that explains how to rapidly iterate based on customer feedback, illustrated with real world examples.

Speaker Bio: Dan Olsen is an entrepreneur, consultant, and Lean product expert. At Olsen Solutions, he works with companies to build great products and strong product teams, often as interim VP of Product. His clients include Facebook, Box, Microsoft, Medallia, and One Medical Group. Prior to consulting, Dan worked at Intuit, where he led the Quicken product team. He also led product management at social networking pioneer Friendster and was the cofounder and CEO of TechCrunch award winner YourVersion, a personalized news startup. Dan wrote the bestseller The Lean Product Playbook, published by Wiley, and organizes the Lean Product & Lean UX Silicon Valley Meetup.


Many thanks to  Capital Factory for hosting and CraftsmanPM for sponsoring the event.

Please note: If you arrive early, food (Pizza) and drinks (soda) will be available. The front desk members at Capital Factory can validate your car parking at the Omni Hotel garage (brings down your parking to $5 for the event).
name: The Lean Product Playbook by Dan Olsen

Signing up here on Meetup page alone is not sufficient! Thank you.

Product Austin is excited to bring you Todd Olson to our special event during SXSW.

Speaker Bio:  Todd Olson is Founder and CEO of Pendo. Pendo compiles and analyzes data that product managers need to make the right decisions about the development of software. Todd has raised over $11 million to help his customers create more engaging products. 

Todd recently served as Vice President of Products at Rally Software Development Corp. Mr. Olson led the evolution of Rally’s proven Agile ALM platform for enabling software and product-driven enterprises through its public offering. He co-founded 6th Sense Analytics, Inc., served as its President and Chief Technology Officer and led the fundraising of $7 million in seed capital. Mr. Olson was Chief Scientist of the Together business unit of Borland Software that he joined as a result of the successful acquisition of TogetherSoft. Mr. Olson co-founded Cerebellum Software Inc. and served as its Chief Technology Officer. Mr. Olson frequently speaks at leading industry events on the topics of Agile software development, Product Management, and entrepreneurship. He has a Bachelor of Science degree from Carnegie Mellon University in Electrical and Computer Engineering and is a graduate of its Entrepreneurial Management program.

Many thanks to  Capital Factory for hosting and CraftsmanPM for sponsoring the event.

Please note: If you arrive early, food (Pizza) and drinks (soda) will be available. The front desk members at Capital Factory can validate your car parking at the Omni Hotel garage (brings down your parking to $5 for the event).

Please note change of location for April event.

Please DO NOT register if you are not going to attend. Signing up here on Meetup page alone is not sufficient! Thank you.

Product Austin is excited to bring you Mark Roberge to our April speaker event.

Speaker Bio:  

Mark is Chief Revenue Officer of HubSpot Sales Products. Prior to this role, Mark served as HubSpot's SVP of Worldwide Sales and Services from 2007 to 2013, during which time he increased revenue over 6,000% and expanded the team from 1 to 450 employees. These results placed HubSpot #33 on the 2011 INC 500 Fastest Growing Companies list. Mark was ranked #19 in Forbes' Top 30 Social Sellers in the World. He was also awarded the 2010 Salesperson of the Year at the MIT Sales Conference. Prior to HubSpot, Mark founded and/or held executive positions at start-ups in the social media and mobile sector. Mark started his career as a Technology Consultant with Accenture.

Mark holds an MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management where he was a semi-finalist in the 2005 MIT $50K Business Plan competition and was awarded the Patrick McGovern award for his contributions to entrepreneurship at MIT. He holds a bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering from Lehigh University. Mark has been featured in the Wall Street Journal, Forbes Magazine, Inc Magazine, BostonGlobe, TechCrunch, Harvard Business Review, and other major publications for his entrepreneurial ventures. He is the author of best-selling, award-winning book "The Sales Acceleration Formula: Using Data, Technology, and Inbound Selling to go from $0 to $100 Million".
name: How a former engineer moved to sales and scaled revenue from $0 to $100 million:

Speaker Bio: Dennis Mortensen is the CEO and Founder of x.ai, whose artificial intelligence driven personal assistant lets people schedule meetings using plain English and nothing more than a CC to [masked]. He’s a pioneer and expert in the analytics, optimization, and big data space and has been since its inception – he is also a fully-fledged entrepreneur and successfully delivered a number of company exits. A native of Denmark, Mortensen currently calls New York City his home.
